Why Work for Frontier Airlines?
At Frontier, we believe the skies should be for everyone. We deliver on this promise through our commitment to Low Fares Done Right. This is more than our tagline - it’s our driving philosophy. Every member of Team Frontier has an important role to play in bringing this vision to life. Our successful business model allows travelers to take advantage of our fast-growing route network while our bundled and unbundled pricing options allow our customers to personalize their travel experience and only pay for the services they need – saving them money along the way.
What We Stand For
Low Fares Done Right is our mission and we strive to bring it to life every day. Our ‘Done Right’ promise means delivering not only affordable prices, but making travel friendly and easy for our customers. To do this, we put a great deal of care into every decision and action we take. We must be efficient with the use of our resources and make smart decisions about how we run our business. We must also innovate and be pioneers - we’re not afraid to try new things. While our business requires us to fly high in the air, we also consider ourselves down-to-earth in our approach, creating a warm and friendly experience that truly demonstrates Rocky Mountain Hospitality.
Work Perks
At Frontier, we like to think we’re creating something very special for our team members. Work is why we’re here, but the perks are nice too:
Flight benefits for you and your family to fly on Frontier Airlines.
Buddy passes for your friends so they can experience what makes us so great.
Discounts throughout the travel industry on hotels, car rentals, cruises and vacation packages.
Discounts on cell phone plans, movie tickets, restaurants, luggage and over 2,000 other vendors.
Enjoy a ‘Dress for your Day’ business casual environment.
Flexible work schedules that support work/life balance.
Total Rewards program including a competitive base salary, short term incentives, long-term incentives, paid holidays, 401(k) plan, vacation/sick time and medical/dental/vision insurance that begins the 1st of the month following your hire date.
We play our part to make a difference. The HOPE League, Frontier Airlines’ non-profit organization, is dedicated to providing employees financial assistance during catastrophic hardship.
Who We Are
Frontier Airlines is committed to offering ‘Low Fares Done Right’ to more than 100 destinations and growing in the United States, Canada, Dominican Republic and Mexico on more than 350 daily flights. Headquartered in Denver, Frontier’s hard-working aviation professionals pride themselves in delivering the company’s signature Low Fares Done Right service to customers. Frontier Airlines is the proud recipient of the Federal Aviation Administration’s 2018 Diamond Award for maintenance excellence and was recently named the industry’s most fuel-efficient airline by The International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT) as a result of superior technology and operational efficiencies
What Will You Be Doing?
The Technical Data Specialist audits online or hard-copy records for the approved maintenance record database daily, ensuring all maintenance entries are accounted for and accurate. This position organizes and reviews all aircraft data relating to the TCI, aircraft flight times, aircraft log pages, and maintenance activities that have been performed on the aircraft to ensure proper airworthiness in accordance with CFRs.
Essential Functions
Daily audit all of Line Maintenance, RON Maintenance, C-Check, stations, MCC, Technical Services, and Maintenance Planning entries online and in approved maintenance record database
Ensure all maintenance records entered into the ERRP System are received into the correct maintenance record database by the appropriate department daily
Perform real time audits (to include mechanic sign-offs, aircraft manual references, etc.) of all
completed RON or ADHOC (OOS/AOG)/Line Maintenance Work Packages for completion, accuracy, and data entry into FMIS.

Other Functions
Accurately audit and enter into FMIS all aircraft parts transactions, or, if previously entered into
FMIS, verify all entries are in agreement with documentation provided (Maintenance Logbook) or are properly documented and accounted for, (i.e., Maintenance Logbook pages, Non-Routines)
Track discrepancies and escalate at certain intervals to ensure corrections are performed and
uploaded to the ERRP System
Answer daily requests from departments looking for DFPs or times/cycles on components
Qualifications
High school diploma or GED
Preferred - associates degree or equivalent work experience
Preferred - Previous records experience either Aviation, Legal, or Medical

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Proficient with Adobe, Microsoft Office (e.g., Outlook, Excel)
Must demonstrate behavior that portrays the company core values of Safety, Respect, Trust,
Collaboration, Value, and Passion while communicating with personnel and acting on behalf of the company

Equipment Operated
Copy machine
Document scanner
Desktop computer
Work Environment
Typical office environment, adequately heated and cooled
Physical Effort
Position requires strenuous physical work. Heavy lifting, pushing or pulling of objects up to 100 pounds occasionally and/or up to 50 pounds frequently.
Supervision Received
General Supervision: The incumbent performs a variety of routine work within established policies and procedures and receives detailed instructions on new projects and assignments.
Positions Supervised
None

Workplace Policies
At Frontier Airlines, we wholeheartedly support and have a strong commitment to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action. Frontier is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender variance, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, martial status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, military, veteran status, and any other basis protected by federal, state, or local laws.
Diversity is an essential part of our success. Our company flourishes because of the unique backgrounds, skills and ideas that our team members contribute every day. We salute and actively recruit veterans. Military experience is valuable and transferable to many of the positions essential to the operations of our airline.
Frontier Airlines is a Zero Tolerance Drug-Free Workplace. All prospective DOT safety-sensitive employees are subject to pre-employment testing for the following drugs and their metabolites: Marijuana, Cocaine, Amphetamines, Opioids and Phencyclidine (PCP). Further, any DOT safety-sensitive job applicant who is found to have tested positive on any required drug or alcohol test at a former employer will be considered ineligible for employment with Frontier.

Best Postcard is a one stop shop for companies looking to build and brand their business. We primarily provide our services to the home improvement, insurance, and gym industries. Services we provided include data analysis, targeted marketing, ROI, graphic design, digital printing, offset printing, post print finishing, promotional products, direct mail, shared mail, and email campaigns.
What really sets us apart from other mail houses is our love of data and reports. For the longest time, we went about doing business like every other mail shop (taking orders from any clients who comes along and sending the mail wherever they thought fit). As email and pay per click became more popular, the direct mail industry started to cool down. We quickly realized we had to change our ways, and that’s when we discovered our passion for data analytics. We are now able to dive into our client’s databases and provide them with meaningful information, such as where to market and why. Post mailing, we are able to provide ROI reports that break down mailings by offers, physical attributes, and list type.
Our company is growing with no slowing down in sight, which means we need talented individuals to join our team. We are currently in need of an individual who can grow our data team and take it to the next level. This individual will need excellent skills managing a team, a solid background in analytics, preferably marketing, and a thirst for data.

Analyzing client data to determine prime marketing territories.

Job Summary:
The Database and Application Coordinator will work with business managers to organize and manage key applications, processes, activities, and resources. Responsibilities include coordinating with vendors on organizing and tracking application development, as well as commmunicating with key stakeholders for consultation and requirements gathering.

Works with key stakeholders to gather requirements for software applications, business processes, and database development.
Executes User Acceptance Testing and/or Application Testing.
Reviews project requirements, identifying interdependencies with internal and external departments or service providers, delegating responsibilities, and ensuring that work is completed by deadline.
Leads meetings effectively in Teams. • Setting priorities and holding others accountable in achieving deliverables.
Presents a professional demeanor and communicates with the required level of expertise, while considering the stakeholder’s technical knowledge.
Prepares reports with relevant data as requested through the VP of Information Technology and Compliance. • Works with the appropriate vendors, technical staff, business users, and partners to identify appropriate solutions.

Other duties as assigned.

Project Management – Ability to work on projects with firm deadlines, project plans, and budgets.

Ability to work effectively in a team setting and independently on concurrent processes and projects to meet established goals, deadlines, and quality standards.
Communication – Ability to listen to others, process information, and communicate effectively in oral and written formats, including knowledge of the structure and content of the English language.

Knowledge of information technology applications, databases, processes, software, and hardware.

Ability to maintain visibility on long-term project goals and objectives.
Strong time-management skills.

About us
OOCCAC is a local non-profit agency comprised of a volunteer board and paid staff members who help clients throughout Okanogan County with various social service needs. Okanogan County Community Action Council’s mission is to "Lead a Revolt on Poverty Through Education, Empowerment, and Engagement.JOB DESCRIPTION
Data Integrity Specialist
NON-EXEMPT
The Data Integrity Specialist will ensure timely, accurate, relevant, and complete reporting of data, coordinate testing of statistical data, data analysis, and consult on data improvement policy and procedures. The Data Integrity Specialist will excel at customer support.
The Data Integrity Specialist is responsible for maintaining the integrity of the veteran department’s client records and assists in monitoring audits. They perform analysis and evaluation of potential duplicates and demographic changes utilizing multiple databases and then performs the necessary merges and changes in the agency’s case management system to ensure that each client only has one record.
Participates in additional projects as needs that promote the prevention of duplicates and compromises in the agency’s case management system and HMIS. They evaluate information in client records to identify duplicate clients in agency’s case management system.
This position is supervised by and accountable to the Veterans Services Manager.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Oversee and Monitor Advocates case loads to ensure equal client distribution.
Screen and direct incoming calls and walk-ins to the appropriate staff and take/forward messages when staff members are away from his/her desk.
Conduct veteran initial eligibility intake interviews and complete warm introductions to advocates.
Coordinate with program manager to maintain and implement a secured standardized filing, reporting, retrieval and protection system for records, reports, and other information, as required.
Assisting advocates with expense data entries in all databases and tracking forms.
Monitoring SSVF program updates to implement new form program requirements.
Consults with program staff for clarification or to resolve discrepancies for inclusion, correction, or for update of information reported.
Provides feedback on current data collection processes and compliance to support data quality procedures.
Assists the IT Systems Specialists in developing data structures and reporting mechanisms to enhance, expand, and improve data analysis tools for the management team.
Maintain data error logs to review with Program manager and leadership team.
Attending staff training, staff meetings, and other professional trainings as required.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experiences to investigate any data issue and provide solution.
Must be able to be work effectively in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities.
Knowledge of databases, IT, and ability to learn technical software.
Ability to work as a team, as well as an individual.
Meticulous attention to detail.
Highly systematic in their approach to solving problems and understand a wide range of best practices that they can use to resolve common issues.
The ability to prioritize tasks.
Provide administrative support to a specific area of the organization such as HR, Finance, Program Development.
Willingness and ability to travel on agency business.
Valid Washington Auto Insurance coverage.
Valid Washington State driver’s license with acceptable driving record.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS ON THE JOB
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is constantly required to sit, talk, see, and hear. The employee is constantly required to stand, walk, or use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, standard keyboards and office equipment or controls and reach with hands and arms. The employee will occasionally need to lift and/or move objects up to 20 pounds and seldom lift and/or move objects up to 20 pounds above their head. Noises in the work environment are usually moderate.

Data Center Customer Operations Technician
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 245+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.
We are a fast-growing global company with 80 quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of 10,000+ companies, including 2,000+ networks and 3,000 cloud and IT service providers in 32 countries spanning six continents.
Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best-in-class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.
Job Summary
Data Centers are considered Critical Facilities. This means that we support hospitals, laboratories, public safety centers. Simply put - We cannot go dark. In this crucial role, you will be responsible for fixing and installing sophisticated circuits and performing custom installations.
Responsibilities
Racks and stacks customer equipment
Reads installation plans (Visio Drawings / Spreadsheets) and implements installation accordingly
Installs circuits requiring sophisticated fiber terminations
Resolves work priorities from a ticketing queue and ensures consistency to all contribute times
Troubleshoots switched / multiplexed / media converted circuits; escalates to, and works with networking group, as needed
Works with customers to troubleshoot issues
Installs/tests/modifies cross connects per SOPs and ensures accurate cable management of coax, fiber, twisted pair copper, and intra-building cross connects
Installs and tests sophisticated cross connects circuits (switched, multiplexed, etc.)
Maintains detailed written records of all work activity
Designs and leads cage / infrastructure modification projects
Finishes the assigned training in a timely manner
Supports customer happiness through timely and detailed order execution
Qualifications
3+ years experience
High School Diploma
BERT and SONET test equipment
Able to perform all essential job functions, including walking, standing, bending, stooping, climbing, lifting and manual dexterity, with or without reasonable accommodation
Able to lift heavy equipment/items up to 50 pounds
Able to work days/nights/weekends/holidays, if needed and/or required

Overview:
For over 50 years, the HealthDirect team has been dedicated to the unique pharmacy needs of individuals residing in Long-Term Care (LTC) facilities such as nursing homes and assisted living facilities, as well as correctional facilities and group homes.”. On a daily basis our team provides prescription medications, over-the-counter products, clinical consulting services, and specialty pharmacy services to more than 50,000 residents.

HealthDirect is a division of KPH Healthcare Services, a billion dollar, 100% employee owned provider of pharmaceutical and healthcare services. KPH is comprised of four divisions – Kinney Drugs, ProAct Inc., HealthDirect and Noble Health Services. The family of KPH Healthcare Services began with Kinney Drugs retail in 1903. All KPH family company values stem from Kinney’s long-standing commitment to trust and community-minded health solutions.

As a team, HealthDirect has achieved significant growth. Over the past 6 years we have grown from four pharmacies in two states to 20 pharmacies across eight states. Our team has grown to over 900 employees and we are looking to add another – possibly you!

Purpose and Scope of Job:
Primarily responsible for planning level production flow in the Machine shop. Monitoring performance in individual cells compared with plan, and make adjustments as necessary, based on changing business needs. Analyzing production data to make recommendations for changes in materials and process management.
Essential Functions (other duties may be assigned:
Create weekly & monthly production plan for SMA’s manufacturing areas, using data from Sumitomo’s IT system, as well as input from other functional areas, such as Customer service, Distribution center, and Assembly planners.
Create & maintain customized schedules for each manufacturing area, with input from Manufacturing Engineering, Maintenance and Machine shop management.
Manage Make vs Buy queries (ME queue) with support from Manufacturing Engineering.
Periodically run a variety of reports to assist Machine shop management with identifying potential production problems and delays.
Data Analyst functions:
Analyze material usage expectations in the machine shop. Use this to make informed recommendations for planning, inventory control, & material purchasing decisions.
Assist Manufacturing management with analysis of tooling & supplies usage, as well as other targeted budget items.
Minimum Qualifications:
At least 6 years of data analysis and production planning experience, OR 4-year degree in Mechanical / Industrial Engineering / Mathematics or related field.
At least 4 years of daily experience in using MS Excel to analyze large amounts of data, and the ability to present such data in formats appropriate to groups with varying computer skills.
Ability to understand & interpret complex engineering drawings and GD&T.
Strong problem solving skills.
Work Conditions & Physical Environment:

Must have the ability to sit for extended periods of time; exhibit manual dexterity to dial a telephone, to enter data into a computer terminal/typewriter; to see and read a computer screen and printed material with or without vision aids; hear and understand speech at normal levels and on the telephone; speak in audible tones so that others may understand clearly in person and on the telephone; ability to
understand and follow oral and written instructions; physical agility to lift up to 50 pounds. The noise level in the work environment is usually very loud. This position is designated as safety- sensitive. (Referenced Document Number 218001, SMA’s Corporate Policies Procedure Manual, 33.0 Drug and Alcohol Use Policy).

Position Summary
A core member of our Data Center support team providing primary Operations in customer datacenters. The Data Center Support Technician (DCST) is responsible for supporting customers, provides routine maintenance oversight and monitoring of Data Center Infrastructure. This position will help provide installations and respond to Customer and Data Center Infrastructure alarms. The role will deliver high level Customer Satisfaction along with timely and accurate Support Ticket completion. The DCST will ensure work will be properly scheduled, in keeping with prescribed periodicities and schedules. Contractor work will be accomplished under direct supervision by the DCST or supporting staff. The DCST will ensure all work performed strictly adheres to H5 policies, guidelines, and standards.
This position reports to the Facility Manager.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
· Provide 1st & 2nd level support to assist in the diagnosis and resolution of customer incidents
· Develops, enhances and maintains documentation for use in problem analysis and resolution (Includes RCAs and follow-up)
· Register customers into the site Security Access Control System. Can also sign-in vendors and visitors to provide access and escort to the facility and data hall
· Perform Remote Hands services for customers including; hardware installation, power strips, rails, cable management and customer equipment troubleshooting/reboots
· Support Service Order installation and cross-connect troubleshooting
· Perform installation, termination, testing and labeling of cross connects and provide remote hands services
· Performs Security and facility walkthroughs/ rounds
· Perform Installation of cage, cabinets, cabling and fiber tray
· Available during unscheduled days or shift times for emergency coverage
· Participate in Infrastructure MOP’s and proper execution
· Properly receive and log items in and out of Shipping & Receiving
· Responsibilities and duties may change, expand, etc. flexibility and the ability to adapt is a must.
Knowledge/Skills required

job title: Data Analyst, Grants and Contracts Director
job description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Data Analyst/Grants and contracts has a deep understanding of SQL and Access Systems with a deep understanding of healthcare management analytics. Responsible for building and maintaining reports and budgets to funders, including but not limited to, the Federal Government, State and Local Entities, Grantor Foundations, and Contracts. Will oversee 340b program and ensures compliance. Demonstrates experience in developing efficient strategies and business plans for all communications aspects. The Data Analyst/Grants & Contracts exercises discretion and independent judgment in substantial or important matters. The incumbent is part of the CHC Executive Management Team and will play a key role in Data Analytics, overseeing of Grants and improving our communications that fits with the values, mission, and services of CHC.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
1. Builds a data systems infrastructure that aligns with short-term & long-term strategic vision.
2. Knowledge of the Data Management Systems, including SQL and Microsoft Access
3. Oversees all reporting requirements for grants and contracts and ensures deadline deliverables are reached.
4. On a weekly basis, develops and maintains a reporting process and provides timely reports to the Executive and Finance Directors on deliverables.
5. On a monthly basis, develops and maintains provider productivity reporting that aligns with the CHC provider compensation plan.
6. Collaborates with Program Directors to ensure all necessary information related to various grants and contracts is maintained.
7. Maintains records on current federal, state, and local sources of funding.
8. Assists the required data, assists, co-develops and satisfies all requirements for the Uniform Data System (UDS) report on an annual basis.
9. Assists external accounts and agencies in financial audits or review of CHC fiscal operations or grant/contract reporting.
10. Oversees the 340b program and ensures that CHC is compliant with 340b requirements.
11. Works with 340b Third Party Vendor and provides updates CHC leadership and providers on best practices.
12. Plans and organizes communications functions and operations and ensures that CHC’s voice is present in the community.
13. Utilizes all aspects of communication tools to promote CHC.
14. Performs other related duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
· Excellent writing and communication skills.
· Extensive experience with Microsoft Excel and Access.
· Proven ability to follow-up and monitor numerous simultaneous tasks.
· Proven ability to meet hard deadlines.
· Proven ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff personnel.
· Experience: 5+ years in Healthcare Analytics
The Following are Helpful for the Incumbent:
· Knowledge of the healthcare field and the Utah community.
· Experience and/or knowledge of the medically under-served population.
· Medicaid/Medicare reporting experience.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $85,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Tuition reimbursement
Schedule:
8 hour shift

All employees are required to wear a mask and must be vaccinated. The health and safety of our employees and patients are our number one priority.

West Valley City, UT 84119: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Position Summary
A core member of our Data Center support team providing primary Operations in customer datacenters. The Data Center Support Technician (DCST) is responsible for supporting customers, provides routine maintenance oversight and monitoring of Data Center Infrastructure. This position will help provide installations and respond to Customer and Data Center Infrastructure alarms. The role will deliver high level Customer Satisfaction along with timely and accurate Support Ticket completion. The DCST will ensure work will be properly scheduled, in keeping with prescribed periodicities and schedules. Contractor work will be accomplished under direct supervision by the DCST or supporting staff. The DCST will ensure all work performed strictly adheres to H5 policies, guidelines, and standards.
This position reports to the Facility Manager.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
· Provide 1st & 2nd level support to assist in the diagnosis and resolution of customer incidents
· Develops, enhances and maintains documentation for use in problem analysis and resolution (Includes RCAs and follow-up)
· Register customers into the site Security Access Control System. Can also sign-in vendors and visitors to provide access and escort to the facility and data hall
· Perform Remote Hands services for customers including; hardware installation, power strips, rails, cable management and customer equipment troubleshooting/reboots
· Support Service Order installation and cross-connect troubleshooting
· Perform installation, termination, testing and labeling of cross connects and provide remote hands services
· Performs Security and facility walkthroughs/ rounds
· Perform Installation of cage, cabinets, cabling and fiber tray
· Available during unscheduled days or shift times for emergency coverage
· Participate in Infrastructure MOP’s and proper execution
· Properly receive and log items in and out of Shipping & Receiving
· Responsibilities and duties may change, expand, etc. flexibility and the ability to adapt is a must.
Knowledge/Skills required

· Operational experience with security systems, BMS, monitoring and performance
· Proficient with cross connect circuit troubleshooting, media and test equipment
· Fundamental understanding of data center best practices and cabling standards
· Timely Data Center infrastructure equipment alarm acknowledgement and response
· Excellent written and spoken interpersonal communication skills
· Generate, update, and resolve support tickets with direction from senior staff as needed
· Ability to work independently, adjust priorities and handle multiple projects
· Exhibit quality workmanship for all tasks and maintain Data Center space cleanliness
· Basic understanding of data center electrical power generation and distribution, mechanical support equipment such as HVAC, uninterruptible power supply (UPS), fire detection and suppression, building management and security systems
· Knowledgeable and capable with Security Access Control System and NOC monitoring applications.
· Proficient in MS Office, Email and Monitoring System reporting tools.

Purpose and Scope of Job:
Primarily responsible for planning level production flow in the Machine shop. Monitoring performance in individual cells compared with plan, and make adjustments as necessary, based on changing business needs. Analyzing production data to make recommendations for changes in materials and process management.
Essential Functions (other duties may be assigned:
Create weekly & monthly production plan for SMA’s manufacturing areas, using data from Sumitomo’s IT system, as well as input from other functional areas, such as Customer service, Distribution center, and Assembly planners.
Create & maintain customized schedules for each manufacturing area, with input from Manufacturing Engineering, Maintenance and Machine shop management.
Manage Make vs Buy queries (ME queue) with support from Manufacturing Engineering.
Periodically run a variety of reports to assist Machine shop management with identifying potential production problems and delays.
Data Analyst functions:
Analyze material usage expectations in the machine shop. Use this to make informed recommendations for planning, inventory control, & material purchasing decisions.

POSITION DESCRIPTION
Government Grant Data Analyst/Database Administrator, works under the general supervision of the Director of Grants. This role is responsible for creation of reports, dashboards, and other visualizations on data associated with grant awards and projects and business processes to provide insights in support of decision-making efforts. The Grant Data Analyst works as a liaison with departments and Elected Officials to coordinate data capture of all direct and subrecipient data and required reporting. The Analyst also coordinates the capture, transfer, sharing, integration and implementation of data systems, add-ons, plug-ins and bridges. This role is responsible for coordination of database and repository centralizing all federal awards.
ROLES AND RESPONSIBLITIES
Analyzing data using statistical techniques and providing reports. Developing and implementing databases and data collection systems. Acquiring data from primary and secondary sources and maintain data systems Identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets Filtering and cleaning data Maintain record of all grant operating department business processes and controls Suggest and implement approved tracking mechanisms to assist in convergence of data from current spreadsheets to database and upcoming ERP system. Locating and defining new process improvement opportunities Evaluates financial reports and performance reports makes escalate concerns to management regarding trends and potential negative impacts. Assist in the evaluation of the effectiveness of grants, compliance with federal regulations, federal agencies, and specific grant contract provisions. Monitors funded projects to prevent over-expenditure of funds; audit disallowance and ensure awards are fully expended. Evaluates grant expenditure agreements to differentiate between sub-recipients or contractors. Analyzes internal and external financial reports, including single audits. Assist in the set-up of electronic database and repository. Maintains electronic database and repository for efficient data collection and report production. Monitors and report the spending of awards, budget adjustments, contract amendments, grant match and cost allocation plans. Assists in the reduction and elimination of findings and questions regarding costs. Performs special project analysis as requested. Reconciles reported revenues and expenditures to the general ledger for grant and prepares the necessary journal entries for correction and posting. Communicates reminders to departments receiving monies of report submission deadlines and when the grant period will expire and/or when an extension maybe needed. Coordinate with external auditors for financial or audit support requests. Other duties as assigned by the Division Director of Grants and Contracts.
JOB SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
Economics and Accounting Knowledge of economic and governmental accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking and the analysis and reporting of financial data.
Administration and Management Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
Mathematics Knowledge of arithmetic and their applications. Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst, Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques, Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc), Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy, Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Customer and Personal Service Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
English Language Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar. Law and Government Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, government regulations, executive orders, agency rules, and the democratic political process.
Grant Lifecycle Knowledge of the linear lifecycle that includes discovering, creating and programing the funding opportunity, applying, making award decisions, and successfully implementing the award.
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Information Management, Statistics, Business, Accounting, Computer Science, or related field and/or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
(5-6) years of professional accounting experience, governmental preferred, with a minimum of (4) years of grant administration, data analytics and auditing of state funded grant programs, within a governmental entity.
SQL Microsoft Suite including SQL Server and BI, Python, SAS, Oracle

job description:
Overview: Management Science Associates, Inc., (MSA) is a diversified information management company that for over half a century has given market leaders the competitive edge in data management, analytics and technology. Responsibilities:
Diagnose and solve routine problems and incidents enhancing first-level and/or first contact resolution, or in conjunction with level 2 and level 3 staffs. Promote efficiency, customer satisfaction, and aid in consistently lowering the cost per contact rate.

Monitor, analyze and troubleshoot LAN, WAN, communication and server performance. Perform appropriate and accurate corrective actions when issues are identified.
Monitor and manage systems performance and capacity.
Maintain security of the Command Center which includes, but may not be limited to, maintaining key/lock control for all racks and cabinets, escorting clients and monitoring security cameras.
Work with senior Data Center Technicians to create a knowledge base, troubleshoot scripts and maintain known error documentation.
Provide Smart Hands service to internal and external clients which includes, but may not be limited to, tracing and reseating cables, inspect indicator lights, system restarts, re-seating drives/blades, handle tape media and library requests, and perform emergency restores.

Technical certificate or AS degree in an Information Systems-Technology related discipline or equivalent experience
Customer service and communication skills with the ability to develop good working relationships with team members, employees and customers.
Understanding of functions and technologies developed, used and supported by various teams and platforms throughout division and company.
Basic understanding of networks, servers and data center operations.
Ability to interpret system and event messages and alerts via monitoring tools, software applications and generated emails.
Knowledge of Incident Management workflows and automation tools.
Ability to maintain consistent, courteous, and professional behavior with a service attitude, paying attention to detail and accuracy within all incident management responsibilities, while communicating simultaneously with all division members, and internal or external end-users and clients
Ability to grasp technical detail and complexity within the division's infrastructure
Knowledge of and the ability to quickly learn various web-based applications including enterprise incident management tracking system
Ability to work in a very organized fashion paying strict attention to detail
Required Experience

This PowerSchool Administrator/Data Analyst will be instrumental to the overall operations, environment and culture of the school. They will build rapport and establish good relationships with students, parents, staff members and the community.

Low 20:1 teacher/student ratio

World Culture Day

THIS POSITION REQUIRES WASHINGTON STATE RESIDENCY
Summary / Objective:
This position provides senior level development and support for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) processes and utilities, including testing, implementing and maintaining EDI transactions. The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will leverage industry best practices, evaluate current state, and recommend, develop, implement and support new EDI vision and supporting processes. The position plays a key role in PSW’s strategy and will lead efforts in modernizing and rebuilding the EDI environment to support substantial growth. This position is expected to proactively identify opportunities to utilize technology to solve technical and business problems.
The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will analyze, evaluate and collaborate in the redesign of business, IT or operational processes and leads communications with trading partners for EDI transaction set-up and ongoing maintenance and support. The position monitors, resolve / troubleshoot and oversees scheduling of daily batch production jobs including job scheduling as required, maintaining accurate records of all production processing, problem resolution/escalation, and daily request processing. This position will conduct secure transfer of information to and from outside vendors.
Essential Functions:
· Replace manual and legacy procedures with industry best practices to support automation at scale and PSW’s long term strategy.
· Collaborates with others to understand current processes and create new processes and procedures.
Serves as primary resource of knowledge and experience as a technical contact for internal and external stakeholders on any EDI-related issue.
Monitors, audits and maintains interfaces between business systems to include interface between internal and external partners with key focus on Electronic Data Interface (EDI) processes.
Diagnoses EDI process problems of a complex nature, coordinating with other technical and/or business resources as necessary for assistance.
Leads company’s effort to define requirements for EDI applications.
Designs, develops, tests, and implements new software applications and EDI programs, maps, and processes through entire life cycle.
Independently participates in requirements documentation, business systems configuration and defining/execution of acceptance criteria. Document issues and participate in their resolution.
Oversees EDI & batch processes day-to-day to identify and address problems as they arise and to track levels of activity, compiling and tracking metrics for senior management.
Designs, configures, installs and maintains solutions for the administration of production system batch processes, including setup, configuration, installation and scheduling.
Responsible for creating best practices for related systems with supporting documentation and standard operating procedures.
Work closely with other teams to remediate all EDI issues, i.e. (server, network, database, etc.)
Works on prioritized incidents, enhancements, projects, code deployments, application upgrades, and performance testing support.
Participates in the IT Change Management process to lead, schedule and support EDI related changes.
Competencies:
Solid understanding of the EDI needs and processes of both small and large organizations with the ability to implement best-of-breed, enterprise-class solutions to support rapid growth.
Ability to document standard operating procedures and best practice to support environment of continuous improvement.
Working knowledge of EDI Formats: ANSI X12 (834, 837P/I, 835, 270/271, 276/277, 278N/R), XML, HC7, FHIR, and proprietary formats
Meticulous attention to detail; the ability to juggle several tasks in parallel without lowering your quality bar.
Proficient in creating, developing and producing mapping documents.
Solid understanding of business requirements and ability to apply supporting solutions.
Ability to translate business needs into high-level technical specifications and design.
Working knowledge of EDI configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment.
Working knowledge of file transfer protocols including HTTPs, FTP, SFTP.
Knowledge of state, federal and local regulations concerning use, disclosure and confidentiality of all patient records including a strong knowledge of the HIPAA Privacy and Security Act.
Required Education and/or Work Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience is required.
5+ years of experience directly related and progressively responsible experience in EDI systems, preferably in a healthcare environment.
6 + years of experience in the development and/or support of software systems are required.
3+ years related experience including developing requirements, designing and executing test cases in IT
Hands-on X12 health care insurance transaction (834, 837, 270, 271, 999 etc.) data mapping and issue resolution experience
Experience with SQL, relational databases and Microsoft development tools, such as VB, VB Script, .NET or ASP.
Experience with QA methodology and problem-solving techniques/tools.
Experience with multi-tiered client-server and web-based applications.
Experience with working with developers and internal technical teams to develop and test EDI processes.
Preferred Education and/or Work Experience:
Knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid.
Experience creating EDI processes “from the ground up” in a small to mid-sized organization.
Experience with applying Agile Methods.
Experience with healthcare claims and billing file types.
Experience with Citra EZ-CAP or similar systems.
Understanding of health industry diagnosis, procedure and revenue codes and their application.
Experience writing complex SQL scripts.
Understanding of EDI 834 enrollment transactions, including Adds, Changes, Terminations, Cancellations, and error processing.

job description:
The Administrative Office of

Position Announcement
DIVISION OF COURT SERVICES
Charleston, West Virginia
Position open until filled.
The Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia has an immediate professional opportunity for Process Business Analyst in Charleston, West Virginia. This position directly reports to the Director of Court Services of the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia.
Process Business Analyst
Salary Range: $60,000-70,000
Position Summary: This position works with Court personnel, formatting and integrating multiple sources of Court data from different systems to identify trends, data patterns and key areas that require improvements. This position conducts clear and accurate analysis and produces reports for project teams in a concise manner. This position also works with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy clear processes and procedures. This position directly assists Circuit and Family Courts with process improvements, training and reconciliation of financial issues.
Essential Position Duties and Responsibilities:
Develops and maintains process documentation.
Educates employees on how to properly execute those processes.
Understands business analysis of services, business process planning and improvement.
Develops business process review, solution design, functional software configuration, and testing.
User Acceptance Testing for all development
Evaluates business processes to identify opportunities for process improvement.
Gathers business and functional requirements from key stakeholders when needed for application development
Identifies the business needs and provides solutions or steps to the solutions.
Understands the business need and value proposition and can translate and articulate the requirements as a subject matter expert.
Creates and supports design; and documents and maintains processes.
Resolves attorney E-File questions
Resolves advanced service desk tickets
Performs other duties as assigned.
•
Requisite Qualifications, Education, and Credentials:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, or related field. Additional years of qualified experience may replace bachelor’s degree.
Minimum two (2) or more years’ experience in working with trial courts as the Clerk or Deputy Clerk, Minimum 2 years experience in Circuit Court Accounting
Preferred Skills and Knowledge:
Basic knowledge in generating process documentation.
Analytical thinking and problem solving.
Detail oriented and committed to a high level of accuracy.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal and consultative skills.
Strong written and verbal communications skills.
Writing unambiguous, verifiable requirements to a testable level (functional and non-functional requirements).
Experience working in cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with Issue tracking and team collaboration tools.
Statistical and/or spreadsheet applications.
Ability to learn, understand and apply new technologies independently and with training.
Licensure Requirements: NA
Working Conditions (Physical/Mental Demands, and Environmental Factors):
Ability to work nontraditional hours as needed.

Maintain current knowledge on judicial developments and trends in judiciary and court administration through participation in a variety of outside programs, state and nationwide.
Performance Metrics:TBD

Compensation and Benefits include:
Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.
Medical Insurance.
Optional Flexible Benefits Coverage (dental, vision, disability, and excess medical).
Life insurance.
Defined benefit pension plan.
Section 457 deferred compensation plan.
12 paid holidays.
Sick leave.
West Virginia Courts
West Virginia has a Unified Court System,under which all state courts, including the Intermediate Court of Appeals, Circuit Courts, Magistrate Courts, and Family Courts, are supervised and administered by the Supreme Court of Appeals. The Supreme Court of Appeals and its Administrative Office are located in Charleston and housed in the State Capitol Complex. More information about West Virginia’s Courts can be found on our website at www.courtswv.gov.
Equal Opportunity in Employment
It is the policy of the West Virginia judiciary to provide equal opportunity in employment for all persons, and to recruit, select, train, promote, retain, and discipline without regard to race, color, sex, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, or national origin. Further, it is the policy of the West Virginia judiciary to maintain a professional workplace in which individuals are accorded respect, and an environment free of harassment, including verbal or physical conduct that creates an intimidating or hostile environment for any individual on any prohibited basis. As an employer with an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Plan, the Court complies with government regulations and related Equal Employment Responsibilities where applicable.
Application Process
To apply for this position, please send the following completed Court Employment Application (available on Court website at www.courtswv.gov), along with a letter of interest highlighting applicable experience, and a resume, including references.
All positions of the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia are considered at-will and may
be terminated at any time, with or without notice or cause.
Thank you for your interest in employment with the Supreme Court of Appeals of West Virginia.

Overview:
For over 50 years, the HealthDirect team has been dedicated to the unique pharmacy needs of individuals residing in Long-Term Care (LTC) facilities such as nursing homes and assisted living facilities, as well as correctional facilities and group homes.”. On a daily basis our team provides prescription medications, over-the-counter products, clinical consulting services, and specialty pharmacy services to more than 50,000 residents.

HealthDirect is a division of KPH Healthcare Services, a billion dollar, 100% employee owned provider of pharmaceutical and healthcare services. KPH is comprised of four divisions – Kinney Drugs, ProAct Inc., HealthDirect and Noble Health Services. The family of KPH Healthcare Services began with Kinney Drugs retail in 1903. All KPH family company values stem from Kinney’s long-standing commitment to trust and community-minded health solutions.

As a team, HealthDirect has achieved significant growth. Over the past 6 years we have grown from four pharmacies in two states to 20 pharmacies across eight states. Our team has grown to over 900 employees and we are looking to add another – possibly you!

The Revenue & Margin Data Analyst position is responsible to provide analytical support on the day-to-day pricing , forecasting and margin reporting as well as the development of data models and tools that support ad hoc and annual price adjustments & visibility and improvement of forecasting efficiency and effectiveness . This position will collaborate closely with IMMI’s Pricing Analyst and Forecast Analyst roles as well as our product marketing (PLM) , finance and sales departments to optimize profitability through pricing segmentation & visibility and automation of regular forecasting tasks .
IMMI® is the trusted, global leader of safety solutions, helping to protect millions of lives every day. For almost sixty years, IMMI has led the way in developing, designing, testing and manufacturing innovative safety restraints and systems. IMMI’s safety products are found worldwide on car seats, heavy trucks, school buses, recreational/off road, military, fire/EMS, motor coach, and construction vehicles. Privately owned, headquartered in Westfield, Indiana and operating eight additional global facilities, IMMI is also home to IMMI VIP steering wheels and CAPE®, the world’s leading state-of-the-art testing facility.
LOCATION: Onsite- Westfield, IN
RESPONSIBLITIES:
Develop and manage pricing data models that support pricing tools such as Fortier pricing model (item velocity, customer size, margin, etc…) to analyze current and future business.
Work with Finance , Purchasing and PC&L in understanding and applying cost inputs (commodity, labor, freight and inflation) to pricing models and margin analysis.
Work with PLM and sales teams to properly assign and track product attributes & features.
Champion the visibility and analysis monthly on volume and price variances to plan as well as provide analysis on significant variances.
Responsible for providing pricing analytical support for IMMI’s quote development process .
Develop and manage PowerBI dashboards on revenue and margin to support PLM and Sales needs.
Automate weighted moving average forecasts for designated customers.
Support development of forecast models or tools to data clean customer forecast models.
Develop a tool to maintain a quote database that tracks price, cost at time of quote and margins and allows for on-going analysis .
Support business case development for lap exists for new products
Support the t rack ing of RMA / LTA pricing adjustments .
Support the annual price plan analysis and collaborate with Finance and Sales to finalize plan.

Power BI Skills are essential, ability to model large data sets

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Successful record of team collaboration and fostering a culture of client-oriented service
Cross department relationship and communication skills are essential
Experience in multitasking and performing a gatekeeper function across numerous interfaces

Consultis, a premier Technical Solutions Provider and IT Staffing Firm with the single focus of pairing the right candidate with the right employment opportunity is currently searching for a Senior Programmer Analyst – Business Intelligence for a Direct Hire opportunity (FTE) with our client.
Position Overview:
The Sr Programmer Analyst uses data to create business value for finance, operations, marketing, HR, and other functions. Projects can be ad hoc analysis, automated processes, or dashboards. This position will support the creation and execution of intuitive dashboards and analytics reports, and gain exposure to predictive modeling methods and data science solutions. Assist business teams in problems solving with data, support data science, collaborate on models etc. This person must have a passion for learning, data, and problem solving.
Requirements/Responsibilities:
Collect, process, and synthesize data through intuitive visualizations and statistical analyses.
Create and maintain insightful automated dashboards and data visualizations to track key business metrics.
Complete complex data analyses based on requirements.
Manipulate, merge, and mine large and complex data sets (structured and unstructured) from diverse sources, to drive appropriate business actions.
Projects may include: supporting business users who use existing BI reports, creating data sources and reports for new data projects, analyzing legacy code to determine how to re-write it for better performance or against an alternate data structure, reviewing an existing report to update it to use a new reporting framework, etc.
Consistently enhance skills and job knowledge by researching new technologies, software products, analytical methods and trends.
Work closely with key stakeholders and other project team members to understand and prioritize functional requirements and information needs. Participate in the development of functional requirements and design specifications as appropriate.
Envision potential future requirements and business needs to ensure solutions are flexible and extensible.
Provide development and technical expertise to ensure business intelligence solutions (applications) function according to business and technical requirements.
Ensure that all solutions, technical configurations and other work products are thoroughly tested prior to delivery; participate in system/integration testing, QA, and peer reviews as needed.
Adhere to Darden Software Development Lifecycle Methodologies and technology architecture standards.
Contribute to architecture design principles and data standards as appropriate.
Proactively identify and communicate potential problems and issues to project team members/leaders, identifying alternatives and recommending/implementing solutions as appropriate after approval.
Ensure accurate project status and work estimates (ETCs) are always reported /communicated to project leaders/managers in a timely fashion.
Effectively communicate with stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. Ensure issues are analyzed, discussed and resolved in a timely manner.
Work closely with the end-user community in an internal customer support role, answering procedural and data questions, assisting users with report development and use of BI tools, and working with developers to trouble-shoot and support production systems. May include leading small projects and investigating and resolving complex issues.
Train functional users in use of BI reporting and visualization tools as needed to effectively leverage the data warehouse and business intelligence platform.
Troubleshoot complex data and performance issues, tracking to root cause and providing or advising on timely solutions.
Required Qualification or Skills:
5+ years of programming/analysis experience
5+ years of experience across Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse/Data Lake projects in a large global organization
Minimum of 3+ years' experience with visualization tools (MicroStrategy, Power BI, Tableau …etc.)
5+ years’ of experience in SQL programming, with ability to develop complex queries against large disparate data sets
Strong understanding of reporting and data warehouse architectures
Experience with Cloud Data Warehouse products such as Snowflake or Azure Synapse
Experience with large database systems (Oracle preferred)
Ability to work collaboratively within a diverse team and serve a variety of stakeholders with different priorities.
Highly developed analytical, problem solving, with strong ability to quickly learn and comprehend business processes and problems in order to effectively develop technical solutions.
Expertise in working with spreadsheets, Strong understanding of financial concepts and data.
Demonstrated competency in designing, developing and testing complex applications or components.
Demonstrated competency in accurately identifying the scope of work and detailed schedule estimates
Bachelor's degree in IT related discipline or equivalent experience (BS / BA in MIS, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics or Engineering)
Preferred Qualifications:
Ability to work independently, take ownership of tasks and follow through to implementation/resolution.
Resolve end user reporting problems through collaboration with both technical and functional personnel in a team environment.
Exceptional verbal and written communications skills, with an ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms.

company: Green Mountain Retired Senior Volunteer Program
job title: Volunteer Coordinator and Data Entry Assistant
job description:
Position:
Bennington County GMRSVP Volunteer Coordinator / Data EntryAssistant
Reports To: GMRSVP Director Department: Bennington Office
Hours: 40
Date: March 23, 2023 Approved: Executive Director
Position Function: The Bennington County Green Mountain Retired Senior Volunteer
Program (GMRSVP) Volunteer Coordinator/Data Entry Assistant position shall be responsible for upholding the policies and procedures established by CNCS for AMERICORPS SENIORS.
Coordinators will also be responsible for the recruitment, placement and follow-up of volunteers to fulfill the sponsoring agency’s work plans and performance-based outcomes as well as responding to requests for volunteer services within other non-profit organizations/volunteer stations, as well as assist with data entry for Windham and Windsor
Counties. The GMRSVP Volunteer Coordinator/Data Entry Assistant will support and adhere to the mission, vision, and values of SVCOA.
Essential Functions Include:
Bennington County GMRSVP Volunteer Coordinator/ Data Entry Assistant will:
1. Recruit and place volunteers in mutually agreed upon assignments at non-profit organizations/volunteer stations based on the matching interests and skill set of the volunteer that meet the requirements of the grantee’s priority focus areas.
2. Meet performance-based outcomes as identified in grantee’s work plans.
3. Maintain complete and accurate records and reports that reflect the program goals and outcomes.
4. Maintain up-to-date, accurate data in the GMRSVP database on all volunteers, volunteer stations and volunteer opportunities/activities.
5. Maintain the GMRSVP website.
6. Provide orientation and training of volunteers and volunteer stations.
7. Provide at least one volunteer recognition/appreciation event annually.
8. Maintain relationships and supervise volunteers through personal contact.
9. Maintain relationships with volunteer stations through personal contact and recruitment practices.
10. Attend community meetings and trainings as approved by the GMRSVP Director.
11. Actively participate in GMRSVP public relations and community outreach efforts.
12. Assist other GMRSVP colleagues with general program functions, as necessary.
13. Assist with GMRSVP data collection in Windsor and Windham Counties.
14. Assist with semi-annual reporting.
15. Assist with Annual CNCS renewal application.
16. Provide reporting details monthly.
17. Complete other duties as assigned by the GMRSVP Director and SVCOA Executive
Director.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
1. Associate degree preferred in social work, gerontology, or a related field or at least 3 years of experience in volunteer coordination.
2. Ability to maintain client confidentiality.
3. Knowledge of issues related to elder populations and communities while maintaining volunteer/volunteer station direction and confidentiality.
4. Strong organizational skills, including the ability to prioritize and manage a large volunteer base in Bennington County.
5. Ability to establish partnerships and work cooperatively with a wide variety of people and organizations, independently and as part of a team.
6. Ability to learn specific GMRSVP databases.
7. Proficient computer skills with Microsoft Office and other software programs.
8. Excellent written, oral, listening and communication skills.
9. Highly organized, attention to detail, multi-tasker, problem solver.
10. Ability to pass multiple background checks.
11. Ability to pass annual HIPAA training as required.
12. Access to reliable transportation, valid driver’s license and the ability to travel throughout the Bennington County area.
I have reviewed this job description, and I accept the responsibilities of this position.

SUMMARY DESCRIPTION:
The Data and Operations Specialist is responsible for data entry/tracking/coordination/reporting and administrative support to provide objective assessments of CCRR programs and services; in support of agency strategic plans and goals; achieving continuous quality improvement for child care providers; and to effectively identify and plan to address existing and emerging needs. Primary for phones, workshop information and providing administrative support to the agency.
Minimum Requirements:
The successful candidate will possess excellent communication skills, the ability to meet deadlines, and must be a highly motivated self-starter with strong analytical and organizational skills. Demonstrated experience thinking strategically about complex issues, leading to thoughtful recommendations and action plans. Must demonstrate initiative, resourcefulness, and sound judgement in execution of work assignments, and flexibility to work in an environment with widely varying workload levels.
· Specialists Degree in Business Management, Accounting, Finance or related plus one year of related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
· Proficiency in the Microsoft Suite of Office applications with intermediate to advanced experience in Excel, specifically with Pivot Tables, is required.
· Strong organizational, communication, and presentation skills required.
· Must have valid driver's license and your own car.
· Must be able to work weekends and evenings.
· Bilingual, particularly Spanish and/or Creole a plus.
· Knowledge of the child care industry is a plus.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Collect and manage quantitative and qualitative data; maintain and update various databases (surveys, trainings, membership, etc.); maintain the integrity, accuracy, and completeness of data.
2. Organize and communicate data and identify emerging trends that could be relevant for current and potential new initiatives and key partner/funder relationships.
3. Run and analyze reports as requested. Compile data and assist in consolidating and analyzing data for presentation. Identify data opportunities using internal and external sources. Assist agency staff in obtaining statistical metrics for measuring program activities and outcomes.
4. Maintain agency calendar for all events, meetings and professional development seminars. Maintain monthly door calendar.
5. Assess current methods of quantitative and qualitative evaluation and identify and recommend improvements to agency data collection methods. Provide creative yet logical approaches to solving data problems, increase automation, and implement database cleaning strategies and processes; train users to assist in maintaining high quality data entry standards.
6. Prepare workshop leader packets, as directed, to include certificates and attendance sheets.
7. Prepare training manuals and/or binders for training workshops, as needed.
8. Assist staff with troubleshooting on a wide variety of office equipment.
9. Collaborate with internal teams in developing new analysis tools and capabilities. Help build operational processes that will enable us to efficiently and quickly track progress. Work with department staff to increase interactivity of website and other communications channels for reservations, fundraising, and data collection, etc.
10. Handle incoming calls to the agency. Direct calls to the appropriate staff. Greet visitors as receptionist. Provide general clerical support services as required including copying, operating fax machine, postage machine, typing, receiving materials, keeping track of office supplies and ordering as needed, collating materials for events, etc.
11. Process incoming/outgoing mail daily; recording and filing of incoming money. Ensure the database reflects appropriate payment method.

Performs Link 16 network trouble shooting including Joint Range Extension administrator duties

Train new users on unique mission support equipment

Performs setup and operations of Compunetix radio equipment

Computer Networking
Hardware and software troubleshooting
Posses a valid Nevada Driver's License and be able to travel to remote locations
Able to lift up to 50 lbs

Network administration; Tactical Data Link familiarity; Computer Science background
Work Environment
Typical office environment with no unusual hazards, prolonged sitting while using the computer and the telephone, constant use of sight abilities while reviewing documents, constant use of speech/hearing abilities for communication and constant mental alertness.

job title: Data Center Technician I (7 PM - 7 AM with 4 days on / 4 days off)
job description:
Overview: Management Science Associates, Inc., (MSA) is a diversified information management company that for over half a century has given market leaders the competitive edge in data management, analytics and technology. We are seeking a Data Center Technician I to join the MSA Information Technology Systems & Services (ITSS) division.
Responsibilities:
Diagnose and solve routine problems and incidents enhancing first-level and/or first contact resolution, or in conjunction with level 2 and level 3 staffs. Promote efficiency, customer satisfaction, and aid in consistently lowering the cost per contact rate.
Respond to large volumes of incidents and inquiries from internal and external client bases as well as IT staff coordination and escalation, while maintaining level headed, courteous, and professional behavior.
Monitor, analyze and troubleshoot LAN, WAN, communication and server performance. Perform appropriate and accurate corrective actions when issues are identified.
Monitor and manage systems performance and capacity.
Maintain security of the Command Center which includes, but may not be limited to, maintaining key/lock control for all racks and cabinets, escorting clients and monitoring security cameras.
Work with senior Data Center Technicians to create a knowledge base, troubleshoot scripts and maintain known error documentation.
Provide Smart Hands service to internal and external clients which includes, but may not be limited to, tracing and reseating cables, inspect indicator lights, system restarts, re-seating drives/blades, handle tape media and library requests, and perform emergency restores.
Required Skills
Technical certificate or AS degree in an Information Systems-Technology related discipline or equivalent experience
Customer service and communication skills with the ability to develop good working relationships with team members, employees and customers.
Understanding of functions and technologies developed, used and supported by various teams and platforms throughout division and company.
Basic understanding of networks, servers and data center operations.
Ability to interpret system and event messages and alerts via monitoring tools, software applications and generated emails.
Knowledge of Incident Management workflows and automation tools.
Ability to maintain consistent, courteous, and professional behavior with a service attitude, paying attention to detail and accuracy within all incident management responsibilities, while communicating simultaneously with all division members, and internal or external end-users and clients
Ability to grasp technical detail and complexity within the division's infrastructure
Knowledge of and the ability to quickly learn various web-based applications including enterprise incident management tracking system
Ability to work in a very organized fashion paying strict attention to detail
Required Experience

THIS POSITION REQUIRES WASHINGTON STATE RESIDENCY
Summary / Objective:
This position provides senior level development and support for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) processes and utilities, including testing, implementing and maintaining EDI transactions. The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will leverage industry best practices, evaluate current state, and recommend, develop, implement and support new EDI vision and supporting processes. The position plays a key role in PSW’s strategy and will lead efforts in modernizing and rebuilding the EDI environment to support substantial growth. This position is expected to proactively identify opportunities to utilize technology to solve technical and business problems.
The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will analyze, evaluate and collaborate in the redesign of business, IT or operational processes and leads communications with trading partners for EDI transaction set-up and ongoing maintenance and support. The position monitors, resolve / troubleshoot and oversees scheduling of daily batch production jobs including job scheduling as required, maintaining accurate records of all production processing, problem resolution/escalation, and daily request processing. This position will conduct secure transfer of information to and from outside vendors.
Essential Functions:
· Replace manual and legacy procedures with industry best practices to support automation at scale and PSW’s long term strategy.
· Collaborates with others to understand current processes and create new processes and procedures.
Serves as primary resource of knowledge and experience as a technical contact for internal and external stakeholders on any EDI-related issue.
Monitors, audits and maintains interfaces between business systems to include interface between internal and external partners with key focus on Electronic Data Interface (EDI) processes.
Diagnoses EDI process problems of a complex nature, coordinating with other technical and/or business resources as necessary for assistance.
Leads company’s effort to define requirements for EDI applications.
Designs, develops, tests, and implements new software applications and EDI programs, maps, and processes through entire life cycle.
Independently participates in requirements documentation, business systems configuration and defining/execution of acceptance criteria. Document issues and participate in their resolution.
Oversees EDI & batch processes day-to-day to identify and address problems as they arise and to track levels of activity, compiling and tracking metrics for senior management.
Designs, configures, installs and maintains solutions for the administration of production system batch processes, including setup, configuration, installation and scheduling.
Responsible for creating best practices for related systems with supporting documentation and standard operating procedures.
Work closely with other teams to remediate all EDI issues, i.e. (server, network, database, etc.)
Works on prioritized incidents, enhancements, projects, code deployments, application upgrades, and performance testing support.
Participates in the IT Change Management process to lead, schedule and support EDI related changes.
Competencies:
Solid understanding of the EDI needs and processes of both small and large organizations with the ability to implement best-of-breed, enterprise-class solutions to support rapid growth.
Ability to document standard operating procedures and best practice to support environment of continuous improvement.
Working knowledge of EDI Formats: ANSI X12 (834, 837P/I, 835, 270/271, 276/277, 278N/R), XML, HC7, FHIR, and proprietary formats
Meticulous attention to detail; the ability to juggle several tasks in parallel without lowering your quality bar.
Proficient in creating, developing and producing mapping documents.
Solid understanding of business requirements and ability to apply supporting solutions.

Job Summary
This individual will be responsible for the day-to-day activities that support data center operations, support of IT systems, network services, business-critical process and procedures that support the delivery of customer products and services. The ideal candidate is a strongly motivated, self-starter who conducts themselves professionally and works under minimal supervision. Shifts available Mondy-Friday 9am-6pm, or 12pm-9pm. Title:
Data Center Technician
Reports To:
Data Center Site Manager
The Job:
We’re looking for an experienced Technician who is responsible for completing preventative maintenance checks throughout data center (cleaning, basic troubleshooting, inspection). Once unit(s) are identified as unrepairable, the tech will report to Site Manager to create repair ticket. Techs are responsible for addressing units that have been placed in the repair queue, diagnosing unit, and putting the unit in the appropriate status (Repair Complete, In-Repair, etc.). Techs are responsible for bench testing units that have been resolved to ensure the unit is fixed.
Responsibilities :
Maintenance of data center equipment.
Running cables: copper, fiber.
Equipment racking: PDU (including temp/humid sensors), network gear, servers.
Proactive monitoring of all production systems, including remote hands support when required.
Creation and maintenance of cohesive and accurate data center hardware map, including asset management for all ancillary hardware.
Provide first level troubleshooting and support services for client servers and network devices, as well as correction and routing/escalation when situations require.
Maintenance of company databases with accurate/current information.
Processing of all hardware RMA’s.
Maintenance of documentation.
Following all stated policies and procedures.
Keeping the data center and repair center clean and organized.
Ensure all tools, workstations, and laptops are kept in order and neat.
Help with deployment of machines. (unboxing, racking etc.)
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Willingness and ability to follow guidance from other staff members as well as management.
Positive and professional attitude at all times, very high attention to detail
Ability to work autonomously with minimal supervision and in a team environment.
High attention to detail, basic troubleshooting procedures, and basic computer knowledge.
Associates Degree in Computer Science or related field preferred.
2 years’ experience Electrical Journeyman preferred.
2 years’ experience in IT position preferred.
2 years’ experience PC level help desk and repairs preferred.
Must pass a comprehensive background check and pre-employment drug screening.
Work Environment :
This job operates in a data center environment. This role routinely uses standard data center equipment such as laptop computers, smartphones voltmeter’s, hash board testers, scissor lifts, forklifts, ladders, and screwdrivers etc. While performing these duties the employee will be exposed to hot and cold environments.
Physical Demands:
Able to meet physical requirements of the job, such as working on ladders, racking heavy servers (up to 50 lbs.), running cables, lifting miners, bending, reaching, standing for long periods of time, working in hot and cold environments etc.
Position Type/ Expected Hours of Work:
This is a full-time position with 12-hour shifts with 4 days on/3 off. Overtime as needed.
Travel :
Minimal travel may be required.

job description:
The Fred W. Albrecht Grocery Company, DBA: Acme Fresh Markets (“Company”) is a privately held company headquartered in Akron, Ohio with 16 grocery stores in Northeast Ohio. Acme has been feeding the families of Northeast Ohio for over 130 years.
Job Announcement
Acme Fresh Market has been feeding the families of Northeast Ohio for over 130 years. Today, the company operates 16 Acme Fresh Market locations in Summit, Portage, Stark, and Cuyahoga Counties and employs over 1,900 associates.
Title of position: Food Service Category Manager
Position type: Full-time
Location: 2700 Gilchrist Road Akron, Ohio 44305
Position Summary
The Food Service Category Manager is responsible for growing the Sales and all-in Gross Margin dollars for the deli, prepared foods, and catering division by negotiating with vendors, managing shrink and inventory, creating new recipes and finding new items to sell, executing merchandising and promotional plans at store level, and keeping Acme Fresh Market food safe. The Food Service Category Manager will be responsible for creating a comprehensive sales strategy which successfully meets the needs of our customers and achieves category goals. This position reports to the Vice President of Sales and Merchandising.
