The Food Service Category Manager develops and executes customer-focused category plans and drives a selling culture at store level. They are responsible for all financial & customer metrics.

Responsible for merchandising and in-stock position of the Deli

Manage labor hours and wages to achieve great customer satisfaction and budgets
Catering
Responsible for the Catering P&L to include Sales, Gross Margin, and Shrink
Manage cost of goods negotiations for new and existing vendors to maintain lowest cost of goods and maximize margin
Work with Manager of Catering to balance labor costs and sales growth
Support growth of wholesale, social and corporate catering sales

Entrepreneur who owns the business and possesses a strong management skill set: including time management, data analysis, planning and organizing, decision making, problem solving, and delivery of results
Financial management skills, including budget management, expense control and analysis of profit and loss statements
Strong negotiation skills
Ability to manage day to day administrative activities in support of designated category
Ability to adapt and drive change

Ability to work in mobile/remote, office environment and in stores.

JOB SUMMARY:
Responsible for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) ingestion, extraction, and reconciliation processes. The EDI II must understand data sets and formats such as XML, JSON, FHIR, and CALINX; as well as ANSI X12 /HL7 standards like 820, 834, 835, 837,277, 278 and 999. The EDI II will create or modify mapping documents based on our overall needs as well as the needs of high-profile projects, analyze requirements, test systems, export data in EDI formats, and be able to load and transform EDI files into accessible data formats. In addition to ingesting and exporting data, the EDI II will work with the business units on how to reconcile data by creating workflows and processes.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
1. Analyzes and defines EDI requirements for data ingestion and extraction
2. Creates workflows for data correction and error processing with business units
3. Performs data load and extraction from/to EDI file formats (XML/JSON/ANSI/HL7/FHIR)
4. Provides advice and education to internal team and vendors concerning EDI guidelines and capabilities.
5. Creates, develops, and produces mapping documents for both ingestion and extraction.
6. Collaborates with programmers and internal staff to develop and test new or modified systems.
7. Follows SDLC lifecycle processes to ensure efficient and effective data utilization for our business.
8. Develops and maintains communication links with trading partners and oversees integration of information.
9. Periodically reviews system to ensure client needs are met; identifies possible modifications as required.
10. Explains gaps and technical concepts for non-technical audiences as well as come up with solutions.
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
· Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Public Health, Finance, Business, Economics, or related field required.
· In lieu of a Bachelor's Degree, 5 or more years collecting and breaking down high level EDI designs, fleshing out functional requirements, analyzing data, data mappings, and analyzing inter/intradepartmental processes in mid or large enterprise IT environment(s) required
· 5+ years of demonstrated experience in providing specifications on custom software that span Internet, Intranet, Extranet, integration, EDI and client/server architectures with multiple software development lifecycle's including waterfall and agile
· Must understand relational database concepts, table design and structure, joins, data normalization, and data types.
· Experience with HL7, ANSI, and FHIR standards are required.
· Experience with SQL (TSQL, PostgresSQL, MySQL etc.) is required.
· Experience with web service/API is preferred.
· Experience in Microsoft technologies including TFS, SSRS,TSQL, , .NET/C#, Dynamics365, Azure DevOps.
· Prior experience using ETL tools (Informatica, SSIS, dbt, fivetran etc.), Python, R, and BI visualization (PowerBI, Tableau, Looker etc.) tools a bonus.
· 2-4 or more years experience in a healthcare delivery or healthcare business setting preferred.
· EZCAP experience preferred.
SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITY:
Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite particularly Excel

POSITION SUMMARY
The Database Developer is responsible for the development, documentation, debugging, and maintenance of databases and software application technologies for the Supervisor of Elections (SOE) information systems.
The Database Developer reports to the Assistant Director, Information Technology. The position consists of 80% SQL development and 20% coding in other languages.
Performance is reviewed through observations, work performance, reports, and achievement of desired results.
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
R E Q U I R E D :
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
Minimum of five years of development experience with SQL and Oracle databases.
Minimum of five years of experience in scripting and tuning reporting queries in various platforms, such as SSRS, Crystal Reports, Tableau, and PowerBI.
Proficiency with relational databases, both on-premises and in cloud (AWS and Azure) environments.
Excellent understanding of Microsoft SQL Server, AWS RDS for Oracle, Visual Studio, and Windows Server.
Understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment pipelines.
Understanding of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
Proficiency using Microsoft Office products.
Ability to analyze and solve system issues and communicate quickly and effectively to end-users, management, and Information Systems employees.
Prior work experience in a position with rapidly changing priorities and deadlines.
Past position working with projects from conception to deployment with high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment that spans multiple departments.
Valid driver license and driving history that meets SOE driving standards – Successful completion of the Orange County Defensive Driving Course.
P R E F E R R E D:
Eight to ten years of experience with SQL development.
Proficiency with C#/.NET, VB.Net, JavaScript, and Python programming languages.
Knowledge of the Voter Focus application suite.
POSITION FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES:
Develops, manages, optimizes, and maintains SQL and Oracle databases.
Write complex structure query language (SQL) functions, stored procedures, and queries based on business needs.
Design, develop, and maintain information systems & reports using Visual Studio, SQL Server, Toad, Oracle, Crystal Reports, Tableau, and other 3rd party tools.
Provide support for departments through research, analysis, testing, documentation, and training of information system functions in a timely matter.
Improve functionality, security, standards, and performance of databases and in-house software applications.
Develops, enhances, installs, and tests well-designed, efficient, computer software applications based on specifications, using best software development practices.
Assist IS staff with resolutions for department and end-users’ technical problems.
Remain current on emerging technology that may benefit the SOE systems and users; participate in new development, enhancement, and maintenance of systems.
Assist Assistant Director, Information Technology with any special projects as directed.
Ability to support and perform team member’s duties as needed.
Perform all other duties as assigned.

WORKING CONDITIONS
The majority of the work is performed indoors, in an air-conditioned office seated at a desk facing a computer screen. Requires contact with management, co-workers, and other internal personnel of the SOE to provide support with systems administration tasks.
This position requires full-time hours within a scheduled workweek, in addition to extended workdays and weekend work as needed, during election events, sometimes with little or no advance notice.

Complete complex data analyses based on requirements.

Effectively communicate with stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. Ensure issues are analyzed, discussed and resolved in a timely manner.

Troubleshoot complex data and performance issues, tracking to root cause and providing or advising on timely solutions.

5+ years of programming/analysis experience
5+ years of experience across Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse/Data Lake projects in a large global organization
Minimum of 3+ years' experience with visualization tools (MicroStrategy, Power BI, Tableau …etc.)
5+ years’ of experience in SQL programming, with ability to develop complex queries against large disparate data sets

Experience with Cloud Data Warehouse products such as Snowflake or Azure Synapse

Highly developed analytical, problem solving, with strong ability to quickly learn and comprehend business processes and problems in order to effectively develop technical solutions.

job title: USSF Satellite Signals and Data Analyst
job description:
United States Space Force (USSF) Signals Analyst, Mid to Senior, Dayton Ohio
The mid to senior satellite signals and data analyst will be an integral part of a highly dynamic team and will support the analytic and development activities within the USSF Space Superiority missions. The selected candidate will assist in requirements management and perform signals analysis by using customer tools and databases to investigate, characterize, measure parameters, collect metrics, and assess signal usage and behavior. The analyst will work closely with developers, teammates, and other subject matter experts to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and capabilities of specific systems. The analyst will support teams at geographically separated locations in the performance of their duties.
Required/Desired Skills:
US Citizen with active TS/SCI security clearance, successful polygraph required
Minimum 10-15 years performing signal analysis
Knowledge of satellite systems and methods and processes for operation, command and control
Experience with waveform design/application to include digital and analog modulations
Experience performing bit-level analysis of information bearing signals
Experience using signals analysis tools (e.g. Martes, DVT, WVT, Matlab, X-MIDAS, etc) and other specialized tool suites
Data processing using mapping tools, algorithms, intelligence reports and display tools
Experience with formatted digital signals found in military C4ISR, civil, industrial, commercial, and personal applications and links, conveying information derived from sensors and/or control systems
Deep understanding in the theory and implementation of SATCOM protocols, systems and standards
Prior experience training military/staff on these signals and tools
Design and maintain training manuals and programs for signals analysts
Working knowledge of Linux based computer systems
Lead and participate in preliminary design reviews and critical design reviews for software product development
Familiar with analog RF links/environment
Familiar with IP network transport and protocols
Strong interpersonal skills and excellent written and verbal communication skills
Must be willing and able to travel, as required
Education/Certification: BA/BS desired or relevant work experience/history
Security Clearance: Active TS/SCI clearance and be SAP/SAR eligible day 1
Salary Range: 103k to 118k plus annual benefits compensation of 13.8k, plus 401k, annual bonuses, annual profit-sharing plan, paid time off

SUMMARY DESCRIPTION:
The Data and Operations Specialist is responsible for data entry/tracking/coordination/reporting and administrative support to provide objective assessments of CCRR programs and services; in support of agency strategic plans and goals; achieving continuous quality improvement for child care providers; and to effectively identify and plan to address existing and emerging needs. Primary for phones, workshop information and providing administrative support to the agency.
Minimum Requirements:
The successful candidate will possess excellent communication skills, the ability to meet deadlines, and must be a highly motivated self-starter with strong analytical and organizational skills. Demonstrated experience thinking strategically about complex issues, leading to thoughtful recommendations and action plans. Must demonstrate initiative, resourcefulness, and sound judgement in execution of work assignments, and flexibility to work in an environment with widely varying workload levels.
· Specialists Degree in Business Management, Accounting, Finance or related plus one year of related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
· Proficiency in the Microsoft Suite of Office applications with intermediate to advanced experience in Excel, specifically with Pivot Tables, is required.
· Strong organizational, communication, and presentation skills required.
· Must have valid driver's license and your own car.
· Must be able to work weekends and evenings.
· Bilingual, particularly Spanish and/or Creole a plus.
· Knowledge of the child care industry is a plus.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Collect and manage quantitative and qualitative data; maintain and update various databases (surveys, trainings, membership, etc.); maintain the integrity, accuracy, and completeness of data.
2. Organize and communicate data and identify emerging trends that could be relevant for current and potential new initiatives and key partner/funder relationships.
3. Run and analyze reports as requested. Compile data and assist in consolidating and analyzing data for presentation. Identify data opportunities using internal and external sources. Assist agency staff in obtaining statistical metrics for measuring program activities and outcomes.
4. Maintain agency calendar for all events, meetings and professional development seminars. Maintain monthly door calendar.
5. Assess current methods of quantitative and qualitative evaluation and identify and recommend improvements to agency data collection methods. Provide creative yet logical approaches to solving data problems, increase automation, and implement database cleaning strategies and processes; train users to assist in maintaining high quality data entry standards.
6. Prepare workshop leader packets, as directed, to include certificates and attendance sheets.
7. Prepare training manuals and/or binders for training workshops, as needed.
8. Assist staff with troubleshooting on a wide variety of office equipment.
9. Collaborate with internal teams in developing new analysis tools and capabilities. Help build operational processes that will enable us to efficiently and quickly track progress. Work with department staff to increase interactivity of website and other communications channels for reservations, fundraising, and data collection, etc.
10. Handle incoming calls to the agency. Direct calls to the appropriate staff. Greet visitors as receptionist. Provide general clerical support services as required including copying, operating fax machine, postage machine, typing, receiving materials, keeping track of office supplies and ordering as needed, collating materials for events, etc.
11. Process incoming/outgoing mail daily; recording and filing of incoming money. Ensure the database reflects appropriate payment method.

job description:
Nature of Job
Serve as subject matter expert (SME) for all-things accounting and billing. Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to understand and document current needs, practices, challenges, and processes. Create user stories and detailed requirements with an overall goal of creating an outstanding user experience. Maintain a detailed user story backlog and actively support the delivery process in all phases as needed; from creation of initial requirements, daily collaboration with delivery teams, assisting with the QA testing effort, to post-release verification. Serve as the primary resource for core systems project replacements and future upgrades; serve as a resource for others in the organization.

Build and maintain effective working relationships with stakeholders.
Assist in product research and business analysis as needed.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Commitment to company values of customer service.
Ability to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.

Job Description
Provides technical expertise for database design, development, implementation, information storage and retrieval, data flow and analysis. Develops relational and/or Object-Oriented databases, database parser software, and database loading software. Projects long-range requirements for database administration and design. Responsible for developing a database structure that fits into the overall architecture of the system under development and has to make trades among data volumes, number of users, logical and physical distribution, response times, retention rules, security and domain controls. The DBE works primarily at the front end of the lifecycle-requirements through system acceptance testing and Initial Operational Capability (IOC). Develops requirements from a projects inception to its conclusion for a particular business and Information Technology (IT) subject matter area (i.e., simple to complex systems). Assist with recommendations for, and analysis and evaluation of systems improvements, optimization, development, and/or maintenance efforts. Translates a set of requirements and data into a usable document by creating or recreating ad hoc queries, scripts, and macros; updates existing queries, creates new ones to manipulate data into a master file; and builds complex systems using queries, tables, Open Database Connectivity and database storage and retrieval using Cloud methodologies.
Qualification
Ten (10) years experience as a DBE in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity is required. Bachelors degree in a technical discipline from an accredited college or university is required. Five (5) years of DBE experience may be substituted for a bachelors degree.
Experience in Information Assurance: DoD 8570.01-M compliance with Information Assurance Technical (IAT) Level II is required

Performs upgrades and installations to Windows XP/ Windows 7 equipment.

Performs Link 16 network trouble shooting including Joint Range Extension administrator duties
Performs corrective and preventive maintenance on all assigned equipment.

Train new users on unique mission support equipment

Knowledge of Link 16 operations at a minimum of JTIDS 101

Computer Networking
Hardware and software troubleshooting

Able to lift up to 50 lbs

Network administration; Tactical Data Link familiarity; Computer Science background

As a subject matter expert in manufacturing or supply chain, the Senior Business Analyst provides direction and specialist knowledge in applying the technology/application to a client’s business. The goal is facilitation of customer product/application understanding through presentations, demonstrations, and benchmarks.
As a Senior Business Analyst you will be responsible for providing consulting, technical/functional support to clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction with minimal supervision. You will utilize manufacturing and supply chain subject matter expertise to perform needs gathering and requirement analysis for prospective customers. You will be able to provide input to other cross-functional departments pertaining to prospect requests and product enhancements as needed to drive future roadmap functionality items. Senior Business Analyst is a critical role in our consulting organization.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
·        Top notch communication skills, including the ability to simplify complicated topics
·        Possess the necessary business acumen and experience to understand best business practices across a variety of industries and compare customer requirements to ERP best practices
·        Ability to lead consultative discovery sessions, distill the information collected and quickly develop demo scripts that demonstrate a meaningful understanding of a client’s business, pain points and potential opportunities to leverage technology
·        In depth Manufacturing Processes and/or Supply Chain Expertise.
·        Ability to document process flows and business requirements to the development team when customizations are required to meet the needs of the prospect
JOB QUALIFICATIONS
To be considered for this position, the candidate must have at least 5 years of ERP use experience. This individual should have an outgoing personality and be comfortable interacting (and teaching) all levels of internal and external staff.

company: Green Mountain Retired Senior Volunteer Program
job title: Volunteer Coordinator and Data Entry Assistant
job description:
Position:
Bennington County GMRSVP Volunteer Coordinator / Data EntryAssistant
Reports To: GMRSVP Director Department: Bennington Office
Hours: 40
Date: March 23, 2023 Approved: Executive Director
Position Function: The Bennington County Green Mountain Retired Senior Volunteer
Program (GMRSVP) Volunteer Coordinator/Data Entry Assistant position shall be responsible for upholding the policies and procedures established by CNCS for AMERICORPS SENIORS.
Coordinators will also be responsible for the recruitment, placement and follow-up of volunteers to fulfill the sponsoring agency’s work plans and performance-based outcomes as well as responding to requests for volunteer services within other non-profit organizations/volunteer stations, as well as assist with data entry for Windham and Windsor
Counties. The GMRSVP Volunteer Coordinator/Data Entry Assistant will support and adhere to the mission, vision, and values of SVCOA.
Essential Functions Include:
Bennington County GMRSVP Volunteer Coordinator/ Data Entry Assistant will:
1. Recruit and place volunteers in mutually agreed upon assignments at non-profit organizations/volunteer stations based on the matching interests and skill set of the volunteer that meet the requirements of the grantee’s priority focus areas.
2. Meet performance-based outcomes as identified in grantee’s work plans.
3. Maintain complete and accurate records and reports that reflect the program goals and outcomes.
4. Maintain up-to-date, accurate data in the GMRSVP database on all volunteers, volunteer stations and volunteer opportunities/activities.
5. Maintain the GMRSVP website.
6. Provide orientation and training of volunteers and volunteer stations.
7. Provide at least one volunteer recognition/appreciation event annually.
8. Maintain relationships and supervise volunteers through personal contact.
9. Maintain relationships with volunteer stations through personal contact and recruitment practices.
10. Attend community meetings and trainings as approved by the GMRSVP Director.
11. Actively participate in GMRSVP public relations and community outreach efforts.
12. Assist other GMRSVP colleagues with general program functions, as necessary.
13. Assist with GMRSVP data collection in Windsor and Windham Counties.
14. Assist with semi-annual reporting.
15. Assist with Annual CNCS renewal application.
16. Provide reporting details monthly.
17. Complete other duties as assigned by the GMRSVP Director and SVCOA Executive
Director.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
1. Associate degree preferred in social work, gerontology, or a related field or at least 3 years of experience in volunteer coordination.
2. Ability to maintain client confidentiality.
3. Knowledge of issues related to elder populations and communities while maintaining volunteer/volunteer station direction and confidentiality.
4. Strong organizational skills, including the ability to prioritize and manage a large volunteer base in Bennington County.
5. Ability to establish partnerships and work cooperatively with a wide variety of people and organizations, independently and as part of a team.
6. Ability to learn specific GMRSVP databases.
7. Proficient computer skills with Microsoft Office and other software programs.
8. Excellent written, oral, listening and communication skills.
9. Highly organized, attention to detail, multi-tasker, problem solver.
10. Ability to pass multiple background checks.
11. Ability to pass annual HIPAA training as required.
12. Access to reliable transportation, valid driver’s license and the ability to travel throughout the Bennington County area.

Description
Job Description:
You can have a positive impact on the scientific community!
The Civilian Health Solutions operation of the Health Group of Leidos is seeking a Biomedical Data Scientist who will provide technical support to the Congressionally Directed Medical Research Programs (CDMRP) in Frederick, Maryland. This is NOT a laboratory research position.
The CDMRP is a leading funder of research projects across a broad range of medical fields and military health. The Biomedical Data Scientist will work across a diverse variety of research programs in support of the CDMRP’s goal to transform healthcare through innovative and impactful research.
Why Leidos?
Leidos Life promotes excellent work-life balance. You can make an impact and have time for your well-being.
This position is eligible for partial remote work and a flexible work schedule.
Leidos offers many opportunities for career development and advancement within the Life Sciences Group and beyond.
Be a part of a large, dynamic workforce with a broad range of scientific expertise.
Learn more at https://www.leidos.com/career/pay-benefits.
What you will do:
Perform extensive quality control procedures on client data.
Populate SQL database with client data accurately and efficiently.
Respond to team member requests regarding data prior to client scientific meetings.
Interact with team members to ensure client expectations are met in a timely manner.
Execute and update Standard Operating Procedures pertaining to data quality control.
Develop and test new database features prior to release to the client.
Conduct analyses of scientific research portfolio data and research outcomes and assemble data to prepare tables, graphs, and slides.
Successful candidates will possess:
Exceptional attention to detail.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Proficiency with data analysis software (SQL, Access, Workbench).
Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Experience in both online and back-end PHP development.
Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.
Required Education:
A Master's degree in the biomedical or computer sciences from an accredited college or university, with 1-2 years related experience is desired.
Additional Requirements:
This position requires a U.S. citizen in order to obtain a U.S. Department of Defense Public Trust security clearance.
Some local travel within the Washington DC/Baltimore area is required.
NOTE: The program’s base pay range for this position is $70,000 – $75,000 but is not a guarantee. Imagine if Indiana Jones were a software developer who had deep knowledge stored procedures, SQL Server and Oracle Weblogic; plus an interest in building a modern web applications. We’d gladly reward such a candidate with a golden idol (aka great salary, bonus, benefits, the works). If none of that makes sense, bear with us, and we’ll try to explain it better in the next paragraph.
Zurka has a client with an important custom software system that needs to be replaced. You’ll be involved in rebuilding it with modern web development frameworks, and at the same time we also need you to be able to dig into the existing system to understand what’s there and support it while the new system is being built. It’s not a task for just anyone.
The business logic of the current implementation is implemented in stored procedures in a SQL Server. The application has a front end built in Oracle Weblogic. There isn’t much documentation nor a full understanding of the capabilities and requirements of the existing system hence the archeology jokes in the first paragraph. You’ll need to meet with stakeholders, dig into the existing system and work with the team to make a replacement system. In the mean time, if something were to go wrong with the existing system we’d be asking for your help to resolve it.
Required Experience:
DoD Secret or Higher Security Clearance
SQL Server
Stored Procedures
Web Application Development

Laravel Framework
Application Architecture

Company-provided STD and life insurance,
Access to healthcare and dependent care FSAs,
Optional supplemental life insurance and long-term disability,
401k (6 month waiting period, then company matches 100% of first 6% of salary contributed),
Paid vacation, sick, jury duty, bereavement, parental leave,
All federal holidays (yes, even Columbus Day),
Casual dress,
A flexible work schedule,
Job-related certification and training course reimbursement
Top notch equipment,
And a smart, pleasant group of people to work with.

NRL operates as the Navy's full-spectrum corporate laboratory, conducting a broadly based multidisciplinary program of scientific research and advanced technological development directed toward maritime applications of new and improved materials, techniques, equipment, systems and ocean, atmospheric, and space sciences and related technologies.
About Zurka Interactive
Zurka develops web based applications and IT solutions for commercial and government clients. It supports research and development at the US Naval Research Laboratory with on-site staff.

Orange County Supervisor of Elections
Date: February 13, 2023
Job Title: Database Developer
Department: Information Technology
Recruiting Location: Orlando, FL
Position Type: Regular / Full-Time
Salary: starting $61,696 annually
POSITION SUMMARY
The Database Developer is responsible for the development, documentation, debugging, and maintenance of databases and software application technologies for the Supervisor of Elections (SOE) information systems.
The Database Developer reports to the Assistant Director, Information Technology. The position consists of 80% SQL development and 20% coding in other languages.
Performance is reviewed through observations, work performance, reports, and achievement of desired results.
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
R E Q U I R E D :
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field.
Minimum of five years of development experience with SQL and Oracle databases.
Minimum of five years of experience in scripting and tuning reporting queries in various platforms, such as SSRS, Crystal Reports, Tableau, and PowerBI.
Proficiency with relational databases, both on-premises and in cloud (AWS and Azure) environments.
Excellent understanding of Microsoft SQL Server, AWS RDS for Oracle, Visual Studio, and Windows Server.
Understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment pipelines.
Understanding of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).
Proficiency using Microsoft Office products.
Ability to analyze and solve system issues and communicate quickly and effectively to end-users, management, and Information Systems employees.
Prior work experience in a position with rapidly changing priorities and deadlines.
Past position working with projects from conception to deployment with high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment that spans multiple departments.
Valid driver license and driving history that meets SOE driving standards – Successful completion of the Orange County Defensive Driving Course.
P R E F E R R E D:
Eight to ten years of experience with SQL development.
Proficiency with C#/.NET, VB.Net, JavaScript, and Python programming languages.
Knowledge of the Voter Focus application suite.
POSITION FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES:
Develops, manages, optimizes, and maintains SQL and Oracle databases.
Write complex structure query language (SQL) functions, stored procedures, and queries based on business needs.
Design, develop, and maintain information systems & reports using Visual Studio, SQL Server, Toad, Oracle, Crystal Reports, Tableau, and other 3rd party tools.
Provide support for departments through research, analysis, testing, documentation, and training of information system functions in a timely matter.
Improve functionality, security, standards, and performance of databases and in-house software applications.
Develops, enhances, installs, and tests well-designed, efficient, computer software applications based on specifications, using best software development practices.
Assist IS staff with resolutions for department and end-users’ technical problems.
Remain current on emerging technology that may benefit the SOE systems and users; participate in new development, enhancement, and maintenance of systems.
Assist Assistant Director, Information Technology with any special projects as directed.
Ability to support and perform team member’s duties as needed.
Perform all other duties as assigned.
** This is an on-site position. **
WORKING CONDITIONS
The majority of the work is performed indoors, in an air-conditioned office seated at a desk facing a computer screen. Requires contact with management, co-workers, and other internal personnel of the SOE to provide support with systems administration tasks.
This position requires full-time hours within a scheduled workweek, in addition to extended workdays and weekend work as needed, during election events, sometimes with little or no advance notice.
SPECIAL EQUIPMENT
Must possess working knowledge of office machines, equipment, and tools including, but not limited to: Multi-line phone system, computers, laptops, tablets, iPads, scanners, printers, election equipment, and company vehicles.

Processing Coordinators perform data entry, interact with migrant detainees, and perform processing efforts in support of humanitarian efforts. They are responsible for maintaining the well-being of detainees outside of a secure complex, to include inventorying, tagging, and storing detainees' personal property for tracking purposes.
This is a contract position with up to a 2-year extension. To be considered for this position, you must complete a full application on our company careers page, including providing a resume, completing pre-screening questionnaire and testing.
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
· Comply with all applicable Government regulations, policies and procedures when visiting or working at Government facilities.

· Perform roll calls of detainees.
· Perform data entry up to 8 hours per day.
· Draft and maintain administrative paperwork related to the processing of migrants.
· Draft and maintain reports concerning the transportation and deportation of detained migrants.
· Log information about detained migrants into DHS (Department of Homeland Security)/CBP information systems, including the status of welfare checks and conditions while in custody.
· Conduct roll calls.

· Fluent in Spanish and English, both verbal and written, must meet minimum testing requirements.
· Ability to utilize software solutions for data entry and analysis in addition to a proficiency with Microsoft Office Suites. Minimum typing speed of 35wpm at 95% accuracy. Must meet minimum testing requirements.
· Must be able to work any/all shifts, including nights, weekend, and holidays to support 24/7 operation.
· Must be willing to submit up to a LEVEL V background and/or security investigation with fingerprints. Job offers are contingent on background /security investigation results.
· Demonstrate strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Imagine if Indiana Jones were a software developer who had deep knowledge stored procedures, SQL Server and Oracle Weblogic; plus an interest in building a modern web applications. We’d gladly reward such a candidate with a golden idol (aka great salary, bonus, benefits, the works). If none of that makes sense, bear with us, and we’ll try to explain it better in the next paragraph.
Zurka has a client with an important custom software system that needs to be replaced. You’ll be involved in rebuilding it with modern web development frameworks, and at the same time we also need you to be able to dig into the existing system to understand what’s there and support it while the new system is being built. It’s not a task for just anyone.
The business logic of the current implementation is implemented in stored procedures in a SQL Server. The application has a front end built in Oracle Weblogic. There isn’t much documentation nor a full understanding of the capabilities and requirements of the existing system hence the archeology jokes in the first paragraph. You’ll need to meet with stakeholders, dig into the existing system and work with the team to make a replacement system. In the mean time, if something were to go wrong with the existing system we’d be asking for your help to resolve it.
Required Experience:
DoD Secret or Higher Security Clearance
SQL Server
Stored Procedures
Web Application Development
Desired Experience:
Oracle Weblogic
Laravel Framework
Application Architecture

Hybrid schedule (only 2 days/ week in the office)
Competitive compensation,
Health/dental/vision insurance (Three medical plan options; company pays majority of premium for employee, spouse and dependents),
Company-provided STD and life insurance,
Access to healthcare and dependent care FSAs,
Optional supplemental life insurance and long-term disability,
401k (6 month waiting period, then company matches 100% of first 6% of salary contributed),
Paid vacation, sick, jury duty, bereavement, parental leave,
All federal holidays (yes, even Columbus Day),
Casual dress,
A flexible work schedule,
Job-related certification and training course reimbursement
Top notch equipment,
And a smart, pleasant group of people to work with.

NRL operates as the Navy's full-spectrum corporate laboratory, conducting a broadly based multidisciplinary program of scientific research and advanced technological development directed toward maritime applications of new and improved materials, techniques, equipment, systems and ocean, atmospheric, and space sciences and related technologies.

Zurka develops web based applications and IT solutions for commercial and government clients. It supports research and development at the US Naval Research Laboratory with on-site staff.

company:

job description:
New York is leading the nation in the fight on global climate change and the transition to a clean energy-powered economy. With the passage of the Climate Leadership and Community Protection Act, New York has codified the most aggressive climate change program in the nation with goals to reach zero carbon emissions in the electricity sector by 2040; install 9 gigawatts of offshore wind by 2035; 6 gigawatts of solar by 2025; and 3 gigawatts of energy storage by 2030. Additionally, the law creates the Climate Action Council comprised of the leaders of various state agencies and authorities as well as legislative appointments to develop a plan outlining how the state will achieve an 85% reduction in GHG emissions from 1990 levels by 2050, and eventually net zero emissions in all sectors of the economy.
The Data Solutions team seeks an intern with a keen eye for detail who is a team player, dependable, and eager to learn. The Data Solutions team reports to the Chief Information Officer, works closely with the Chief Information Security Officer and Legal team, and supports all teams across NYSERDA.
Interns who are interested in energy efficiency, renewable energy, data management, data and cyber security, open data, or analyzing data are encouraged to apply. The selected intern will gain skills in implementing data management best practices, information security, and data analysis while learning about NYSERDA’s wide breadth of program offerings.
This is a paid internship for current, full-time college students. The pay rate is from $15 to $17 per hour based on current class year. This internship will begin in the Spring 2023 semester with the potential to continue through the Summer and academic year.

Collaborate with other members of the IT department to develop solutions to store, collect, and share data based upon the classification of the data
Summarize notes and action items for key stakeholder meetings
Perform other responsibilities as assigned

Current, full-time college student with knowledge or experience in data management, data security, cybersecurity, or the C-I-A triad.

JOB SUMMARY:
Responsible for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) ingestion, extraction, and reconciliation processes. The EDI II must understand data sets and formats such as XML, JSON, FHIR, and CALINX; as well as ANSI X12 /HL7 standards like 820, 834, 835, 837,277, 278 and 999. The EDI II will create or modify mapping documents based on our overall needs as well as the needs of high-profile projects, analyze requirements, test systems, export data in EDI formats, and be able to load and transform EDI files into accessible data formats. In addition to ingesting and exporting data, the EDI II will work with the business units on how to reconcile data by creating workflows and processes.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
1. Analyzes and defines EDI requirements for data ingestion and extraction
2. Creates workflows for data correction and error processing with business units
3. Performs data load and extraction from/to EDI file formats (XML/JSON/ANSI/HL7/FHIR)
4. Provides advice and education to internal team and vendors concerning EDI guidelines and capabilities.
5. Creates, develops, and produces mapping documents for both ingestion and extraction.
6. Collaborates with programmers and internal staff to develop and test new or modified systems.
7. Follows SDLC lifecycle processes to ensure efficient and effective data utilization for our business.
8. Develops and maintains communication links with trading partners and oversees integration of information.
9. Periodically reviews system to ensure client needs are met; identifies possible modifications as required.
10. Explains gaps and technical concepts for non-technical audiences as well as come up with solutions.
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
· Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Public Health, Finance, Business, Economics, or related field required.
· In lieu of a Bachelor's Degree, 5 or more years collecting and breaking down high level EDI designs, fleshing out functional requirements, analyzing data, data mappings, and analyzing inter/intradepartmental processes in mid or large enterprise IT environment(s) required
· 5+ years of demonstrated experience in providing specifications on custom software that span Internet, Intranet, Extranet, integration, EDI and client/server architectures with multiple software development lifecycle's including waterfall and agile
· Must understand relational database concepts, table design and structure, joins, data normalization, and data types.
· Experience with HL7, ANSI, and FHIR standards are required.
· Experience with SQL (TSQL, PostgresSQL, MySQL etc.) is required.
· Experience with web service/API is preferred.
· Experience in Microsoft technologies including TFS, SSRS,TSQL, , .NET/C#, Dynamics365, Azure DevOps.
· Prior experience using ETL tools (Informatica, SSIS, dbt, fivetran etc.), Python, R, and BI visualization (PowerBI, Tableau, Looker etc.) tools a bonus.
· 2-4 or more years experience in a healthcare delivery or healthcare business setting preferred.
· EZCAP experience preferred.
SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITY:
Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite particularly Excel

This opportunity offers a combination of work from home days and office.
Sales Project & Data Analysis Responsibilities
Serve as Key User for our customer relationship software (CRM) and provide training and support to the Machine Tool Sales colleagues.
Coordinate activities and act as a main liaison between TRUMPF Inc. and German headquarters for customer relationship software and related topics.
Constantly improve customer software to match TRUMPF Inc requirements in the most efficient way Ensure all documentation and system translations are up to date.
Using data analytics to collect and analyze data to evaluate existing and potential customers, markets, products, interpret trends and patterns and find new business opportunities.
Coordinate with Management concerning development of new markets/industries.
Support Management in all aspects of TRUMPFs Sales Excellence Initiative Provide regular updates to TRUMPF Inc Management
Experience
Experience in international project coordination and data analytics required. Excellent communication skills both written and verbal. Desire to work collaboratively across multifunctional and international teams. Proven ability to drive results across hierarchies.

job description:
The Fred W. Albrecht Grocery Company, DBA: Acme Fresh Markets (“Company”) is a privately held company headquartered in Akron, Ohio with 16 grocery stores in Northeast Ohio. Acme has been feeding the families of Northeast Ohio for over 130 years.
Job Announcement
Acme Fresh Market has been feeding the families of Northeast Ohio for over 130 years. Today, the company operates 16 Acme Fresh Market locations in Summit, Portage, Stark, and Cuyahoga Counties and employs over 1,900 associates.
Title of position: Food Service Category Manager
Position type: Full-time
Location: 2700 Gilchrist Road Akron, Ohio 44305
Position Summary
The Food Service Category Manager is responsible for growing the Sales and all-in Gross Margin dollars for the deli, prepared foods, and catering division by negotiating with vendors, managing shrink and inventory, creating new recipes and finding new items to sell, executing merchandising and promotional plans at store level, and keeping Acme Fresh Market food safe. The Food Service Category Manager will be responsible for creating a comprehensive sales strategy which successfully meets the needs of our customers and achieves category goals. This position reports to the Vice President of Sales and Merchandising.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities
The Food Service Category Manager develops and executes customer-focused category plans and drives a selling culture at store level. They are responsible for all financial & customer metrics.
Deli/Prepared Foods
Manages assortment and recipe creation
Develops and executes customer-focused category plans and drives a selling culture
Responsible for the Department Productivity Results (DPR) to include Sales, Gross Margin, and Shrink
Responsible for merchandising and in-stock position of the Deli
Responsible for Food Safety
Manage vendor relationships to develop merchandising plans that will increase sales and all-in gross margin dollars
Manage labor hours and wages to achieve great customer satisfaction and budgets
Catering
Responsible for the Catering P&L to include Sales, Gross Margin, and Shrink
Manage cost of goods negotiations for new and existing vendors to maintain lowest cost of goods and maximize margin
Work with Manager of Catering to balance labor costs and sales growth
Support growth of wholesale, social and corporate catering sales
Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities
Entrepreneur who owns the business and possesses a strong management skill set: including time management, data analysis, planning and organizing, decision making, problem solving, and delivery of results
Financial management skills, including budget management, expense control and analysis of profit and loss statements
Strong negotiation skills
Ability to manage day to day administrative activities in support of designated category
Ability to adapt and drive change
Ability to learn software programs specific to category and catering management
Work Environment
Ability to work in mobile/remote, office environment and in stores.

JOB SUMMARY:
Responsible for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) ingestion, extraction, and reconciliation processes. The EDI II must understand data sets and formats such as XML, JSON, FHIR, and CALINX; as well as ANSI X12 /HL7 standards like 820, 834, 835, 837,277, 278 and 999. The EDI II will create or modify mapping documents based on our overall needs as well as the needs of high-profile projects, analyze requirements, test systems, export data in EDI formats, and be able to load and transform EDI files into accessible data formats. In addition to ingesting and exporting data, the EDI II will work with the business units on how to reconcile data by creating workflows and processes.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
1. Analyzes and defines EDI requirements for data ingestion and extraction
2. Creates workflows for data correction and error processing with business units
3. Performs data load and extraction from/to EDI file formats (XML/JSON/ANSI/HL7/FHIR)
4. Provides advice and education to internal team and vendors concerning EDI guidelines and capabilities.
5. Creates, develops, and produces mapping documents for both ingestion and extraction.
6. Collaborates with programmers and internal staff to develop and test new or modified systems.
7. Follows SDLC lifecycle processes to ensure efficient and effective data utilization for our business.
8. Develops and maintains communication links with trading partners and oversees integration of information.
9. Periodically reviews system to ensure client needs are met; identifies possible modifications as required.
10. Explains gaps and technical concepts for non-technical audiences as well as come up with solutions.
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
· Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Public Health, Finance, Business, Economics, or related field required.
· In lieu of a Bachelor's Degree, 5 or more years collecting and breaking down high level EDI designs, fleshing out functional requirements, analyzing data, data mappings, and analyzing inter/intradepartmental processes in mid or large enterprise IT environment(s) required
· 5+ years of demonstrated experience in providing specifications on custom software that span Internet, Intranet, Extranet, integration, EDI and client/server architectures with multiple software development lifecycle's including waterfall and agile
· Must understand relational database concepts, table design and structure, joins, data normalization, and data types.
· Experience with HL7, ANSI, and FHIR standards are required.
· Experience with SQL (TSQL, PostgresSQL, MySQL etc.) is required.
· Experience with web service/API is preferred.
· Experience in Microsoft technologies including TFS, SSRS,TSQL, , .NET/C#, Dynamics365, Azure DevOps.
· Prior experience using ETL tools (Informatica, SSIS, dbt, fivetran etc.), Python, R, and BI visualization (PowerBI, Tableau, Looker etc.) tools a bonus.
· 2-4 or more years experience in a healthcare delivery or healthcare business setting preferred.
· EZCAP experience preferred.
SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITY:
Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite particularly Excel

Great part-time job for retirees.
Do you enjoy working outside of an office environment? Do you enjoy travel? If so, we would like to talk with you about our part-time job consisting of 1-2 "work weeks" each month. (Must live in Middle Tennessee for training purposes.)
Compensation: $15.25 per hour for the first 40 hours, and $22.87 per hour for hours worked over 40. In some cases, a "work week" can be between 50-60 hours. All travel expenses, (flights, hotels, rental cars,) are paid by the company. Additionally, a per diem and cell phone reimbursement are provided (see below).
MarketGraphics Research Group, Inc. is a nationally recognized leader in the new home market research industry. www.mgresearch.net. What our team has to say about MG…
“Small business team atmosphere”
“Company values its employee”
“Care for client’s success”
“Personable environment”
“Assured frequently that my work is appreciated by management”
We're Looking For: Individuals that enjoy the relaxed atmosphere of working outside an office, are dependable and organized. Our auditors come to us with all kinds of educational and work backgrounds. We find that retired folks really like the job because the schedule allows them to pursue other hobbies or travel opportunities on their off weeks. (Must live in Middle Tennessee for training purposes.)
The Job: During each "work week" field auditors travel to one of our 19 markets and spend 5+ consecutive days visiting subdivisions where new homes are being built. Using a GPS unit you will navigate from one new home subdivision to another. In each subdivision you will count homes and lots and enter that data and other findings into an Access database on a company provided computer. Typically, about 40-50 subdivisions are audited in one day. On occasion you will collect data from county Registers of Deeds offices.
Requirements:
Microsoft Office Suite proficiency in a PC environment
Ability to travel out of town (by car and/or by plane) for 5+ days consecutively.
Provide current driver’s license and clean 3-year driving record
Benefits:
Personal Time: determined based on number of hours worked
Insurance: Eligible employees that have worked with the company for 60 days and work an average of 20 plus hours a week and their spouse and/or dependent(s) qualify for employee paid medical insurance and employer-employee paid dental and vision insurance.
Long Term Disability Insurance: Employer-paid for eligible employees employed with the Company for 90 days and work an average of 33 hours per week.
Per Diem: $35/day when traveling overnight
Cell Phone Reimbursement: $20 monthly
Company vehicle and/or rental provided for field audits
Computer provided for field audits
Travel costs reimbursed (hotel, rental car, airfare)

Premier Southwest Regional Engineering Services Company Seeks
DATA CENTER Building Engineer (Day Shift)
Looking to join a fast-growing team. Excellent benefits, great opportunities for advancement in a dynamic environment
Description
Paragon Services Engineering is looking for one highly motivated and experienced Engineer for a Mission Critical Data Center. This position requires an individual who is self-starter, team player, and have excellent people skills. This positions is expected to effectively operate and maintain the day to day engineering requirements of a Mission Critical Data Center to ensure zero downtime; while performing engineering, electrical, HVAC, and plumbing, repairs, and maintenance duties in support of the facility under the direction of the Chief Engineer and the Facility Manager.
We are committed to providing our customers with an exemplary service to operate and maintain their properties in a Class “A” condition. The Engineer position was established to provide these services at complex properties that require full time multiple engineering staff.
To accomplish this mission, the Engineer’s duties are to operate, monitor, and maintain the design criteria of the buildings operating systems and grounds. The Engineer shall report to the Chief Engineer and the Facility Manager, and they shall provide the following for their assigned projects:
Principal Job Duties:
Strong technical expertise and mechanical/electrical system knowledge is required for this position along with superior administrative, supervisory, and communication skills. Minimum 5+ years’ experience with Data Center Central Plant Operation, HVAC, Chillers, Towers, Boilers, CMMS, BMS/EMS, Switchgear, Generators, Static UPS, Switchgear, Battery Maintenance, Pre-action and Fire Suppression Systems, Chillers, CRAC & CRAH Units, Towers, Boilers, BMS/EMS, Lighting, General Maintenance, Controls, and Vendor Management. Knowledge of ADA, and OSHA is a requisite. Candidates must be fully competent with Microsoft Office Suite. Knowledge of National and Local Codes is required.
· Prepare, maintain and regularly review logs for repair, service, operation and complaints related to the equipment.
· Provide building owner with copies of engineering daily logs and periodic management reports.
· Supply building owner with recommendations for improvements and increased efficiency in the operation of the equipment.
· The overall safe operation and maintenance of all mechanical, electrical, plumbing and life safety equipment.
· Assists the Chief Engineer preparing the building operations budget.

job title: IT Data and Security Support Analyst
job description:
Open Position: IT Data and Security Support Analyst
Reporting To: Director of Information Technology
FLSA Status: Non-exempt
When Needed: Immediate
FT/PT: Full-time
On-site? On-site
Pay rate: $31.25 - $40.86 per hour

Why St. Thomas School?
You thrive in a face-paced environment, working alongside others who share your ideals. You are inspired by children and appreciate their joy and energy. You enjoy making an impact and being part of something bigger than yourself. You believe that schools should be among the most innovative places on earth. And you are committed to excellence and professional growth.

Join a dynamic, innovative team at St. Thomas School where excellence in education meets cutting-edge technology. We're looking for a skilled IT Data and Security Support Analyst to lead our efforts in optimizing data analytics, network infrastructure, device and data security, and support technology needs for students, teachers, and office staff. We're looking for someone with a passion for technology and education, and a drive to stay up to date with the latest technology trends and developments. If you have excellent communication skills, an eye for detail, and the ability to think creatively and outside the box, we'd love to hear from you! Join our innovative school and help us continue to excel in all that we do.

Who We Are:
Founded in 1951 and located on the east side of Seattle in Medina, Washington, STS is a private, non-sectarian school for Preschool through Eighth Grade students. Our educational journey is defined by a cognitively engaging program with an emphasis on developing character, leadership, and a passion for learning and achievement. Our highly regarded curriculum prepared students to excel at future endeavors while honoring the school's long-standing core values.

We commit to an inclusive and diverse community in which everyone can say, "I belong." We seek employees who are passionate, qualified, and offer diverse perspectives. We are particularly interested in the role education and a diverse learning environment play in promoting equity and inclusivity.

We foster:
A diverse, safe, and equitable school environment
Actions and advocacy that support our Core Virtues
Cultural competence, anti-bias, and social justice
Intellectually curious and engaged global citizenship

Job Overview:
The IT Data and Security Support Analyst is responsible for device and network security, data integrity and keeping the school at the forefront of innovation and privacy protection. The position plays a crucial role in enhancing the learning experience for students, teachers, and staff and requires someone with a passion for technology, a detail-oriented approach, and high level of accuracy to help drive our technology initiatives forward! In our cutting-edge school, you will also work with conference technologies, 3-D printers and design software, laser cutters and our theater lighting and audio systems.

General Responsibilities:
Manage InTune and Microsoft Defender Endpoint
Manage integration of services with Student Information System
Manage network infrastructure including firewall, switches and communication systems
Protect systems and information through security policies, assessments and staff training
Ensure data integrity throughout all IT systems
Use data analytics to provide insights in both student learning and business processes
Gather feedback from end-users to continue improving systems
Analyze IT requirements and provide objective advice, and test and evaluate new technology

Required Education & Experience:

Experience managing Microsoft Defender Endpoint and InTune required
Bachelors degree required
2+ years experience of recent IT administration or similar work
Network certifications preferred

Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Exceptional communication skills, both written and oral
Demonstrated technical writing skills
Strong analytical skills
Ability to maintain confidential information
Strong technical knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Microsoft O365, InTune and Microsoft Defender Endpoint
Ability to work and communicate well with others
Ability to lift, push, and pull objects up to 50 pounds, and use a ladder to reach and maintain equipment.
Able to work 40 hours per week on our campus

Benefits include:

Medical
Health Savings Account
Dental
Vision
Dependent Care Spending Account
Long-Term Disability
Life Insurance
Retirement Savings
Winter Wellness Days (between Dec 25 and Jan 1)

If this sounds like you, we'd like to hear from you. Please click on Apply Now on our careers website and complete our online employment application. Then upload your résumé and a cover letter explaining why you are interested in and qualified for this position.

www.stthomasschool.org/about/careers

Position open until filled.

No phone calls or drop-ins please.

Thank you for your interest in St. Thomas School and this position.

This description is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements.

Description
Job Description:
You can have a positive impact on the scientific community!
The Civilian Health Solutions operation of the Health Group of Leidos is seeking a Biomedical Data Scientist who will provide technical support to the Congressionally Directed Medical Research Programs (CDMRP) in Frederick, Maryland. This is NOT a laboratory research position.
The CDMRP is a leading funder of research projects across a broad range of medical fields and military health. The Biomedical Data Scientist will work across a diverse variety of research programs in support of the CDMRP’s goal to transform healthcare through innovative and impactful research.
Why Leidos?
Leidos Life promotes excellent work-life balance. You can make an impact and have time for your well-being.
This position is eligible for partial remote work and a flexible work schedule.
Leidos offers many opportunities for career development and advancement within the Life Sciences Group and beyond.
Be a part of a large, dynamic workforce with a broad range of scientific expertise.
Learn more at https://www.leidos.com/career/pay-benefits.
What you will do:
Perform extensive quality control procedures on client data.
Populate SQL database with client data accurately and efficiently.
Respond to team member requests regarding data prior to client scientific meetings.
Interact with team members to ensure client expectations are met in a timely manner.
Execute and update Standard Operating Procedures pertaining to data quality control.
Develop and test new database features prior to release to the client.
Conduct analyses of scientific research portfolio data and research outcomes and assemble data to prepare tables, graphs, and slides.
Successful candidates will possess:
Exceptional attention to detail.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Proficiency with data analysis software (SQL, Access, Workbench).
Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Experience in both online and back-end PHP development.
Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.
Required Education:
A Master's degree in the biomedical or computer sciences from an accredited college or university, with 1-2 years related experience is desired.
Additional Requirements:
This position requires a U.S. citizen in order to obtain a U.S. Department of Defense Public Trust security clearance.
Some local travel within the Washington DC/Baltimore area is required.
NOTE: The program’s base pay range for this position is $70,000 – $75,000 but is not a guarantee. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

job title: Marketing Database Specialist, Mardi Gras Casino
job description:
The Opportunity
Delaware North Gaming is searching for a Marketing Database Specialist to join our team at Mardi Gras Casino in Cross Lanes, West Virginia. As a Marketing Database Specialist you will be responsible for continuous analysis of the player and customer database and using your findings to assist with development and implementation of all marketing and players club promotional activity for gaming operations.
Minimum – Anticipated Maximum Salary: $43300 - $57400 / year
The advertised pay range represents what we believe at the time of this job posting, that we would be willing to pay for this position. Only in special circumstances, where a candidate has education, training, or experience that far exceeds the requirements for the position, would we consider paying higher than the stated range. Information on our comprehensive benefits package can be found at https://careers.delawarenorth.com/whatweoffer.

At Delaware North, we care about our team member’s personal and professional journeys. These are just some of the benefits we offer:
Health, dental, and vision insurance
401(k) with company match
Performance bonuses
Paid vacation days and holidays
Paid parental bonding leave
Tuition and/or professional certification reimbursement
Generous friends-and-family discounts at many of our hotels and resorts
Responsibilities
Administer and update analysis by combining data from different key database sources.
Continuous detailed analysis of player database to identify opportunities for increased revenue, market share, and spend efficiency that may be achieved with targeted marketing efforts.
Facilitate implementation, tracking, and reporting of all marketing activities through a defined schedule of regular reports. Present results with potential action items.
Develop predictive modeling utilizing historical data for promotional effectiveness and labor needs.
Pro forma and postforma development for evaluation of all marketing initiatives. Forecast weekly future promotional calendar effectiveness against prior year and planned levels.
Coordinate list management and queries for direct mail and email recipients under provided guidelines. Work with mail house, print shop and internal email resources to ensure accuracy of data provided.
Collaborate with state gaming commission.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Excellent math and analytical skills. Must be able to analyze data from various angles and offer all viewpoints for review.
Proficient in SQL. Must be able to create reporting in Excel from data obtained through SQL.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a state gaming license..
Weekends, holidays and swing shift work may be required.
Bachelor's degree in marketing, statistics, or related field preferred.
Who We Are
Delaware North operates Mardi Gras Casino and Resort dating back to 2018. Located 14 miles west of Charleston, West Virginia, Mardi Gras features more than 25 table games, a poker room, more than 850 slot machines, live greyhound racing, and off-track betting for both greyhound and horse racing; several restaurants and a 150-room hotel.
At Delaware North, you’ll love where you work, who you work with, and how your day unfolds. Whether it’s in sporting venues, casinos, airports, national parks, iconic hotels, or premier restaurants, there’s no telling where your career can ultimately take you. We empower you to do great work in a company with 100 years of success, stability and growth. If you have drive and enjoy the thrill of making things happen - share our vision and grow with us.
Delaware North Companies, Incorporated and its subsidiaries consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. Delaware North is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Description & Responsibilities
LeoRose is seeking a mid-career professional consultant who is experienced gathering and analyzing IT, system, business, user and functional requirements. The ideal candidate must be comfortable with multiple approaches, including Agile, to requirements elicitation, solutions identification, risk analysis, and collaboration across IT Teams. The role will support the development of a SharePoint Online application that supports the Department of Navy Integrated Risk Management Strategy through business process and internal control assessments, analysis of functional/user requirements, development of dashboards and analytical frameworks. Team player and strong communication skills to work across teams including internal BAH team members and government stakeholders.

Flexible and energetic to learn new technologies (Axure mockups, etc.), and independently work on deliverables with minimal direction.
An analytical mindset for charting capabilities and finalizing charting requirements.
Creative/design thinker, works well with teammates to ideate and problem solve, and bring ideas to the table.
Audit background is helpful but not required (will train the right candidate), the tool is focused on internal control assessments.
Navy familiarity as a civilian or veteran is helpful but not required.

Position Summary:
The Business Systems Analyst II will work on projects of diverse scope and complexity and serve as the change agent for warehouse processes. This personal in this position analyzes different distribution processes and assesses the scope and impact of each on business. They will identify and document process charts, information resources, distribution paths, and system specifications. The BA II will also help with workflow & process diagrams and conduct gap analysis. They will device and implement new solutions to problems by utilizing the 3Ps -people, process and program- methodology. Implementation of the suggested solutions will be the key aspect of this position.
Primary Job Functions:
Perform data analysis and conduct research related to distribution center operations to identify variance, discrepancies and gaps; utilize the findings to determine opportunities for improvement and recommend timely corrective actions.
Develop reporting tools and create dashboards using SQL, Crystal Reports and Business Intelligence Software to provide higher visibility and facilitate data driven decision making in daily operations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to conduct continuous improvement projects following six-sigma and lean manufacturing guidelines for providing high-standard service to customer.
Create project SOPs and documentation for various projects and build a knowledge repository. Also, help develop a culture of data-driven decision making across the organization.
Incorporate big data analysis to help identify trends and patterns in inventory movement across distribution centers.
Be a team player who can wear different hats within various warehousing functions in order to serve the customer better
Analyze and define efficient, cost effective solutions that support business processes and operational requirements.
Independently initiate, identify, research, investigate, analyze, define and document process changes with the aim of increasing productivity and enhancing efficiency.
Understand organization's direction, structure and requirements.
Identify all affected stakeholders for a project; identify overlaps and related processes.
Evaluate alternative operational efficiencies.
Document and refine system modifications.
Secondary Functions:
May assist in development of project plans using the associated project planning tools, which include work plans, schedules, milestones, critical paths, detailed tasks, and deliverables.
Provide status on project milestones, alerting client/project manager of any potential delays.
Provide expertise to cross functional groups, delivers presentations, demonstrations and training for various initiatives and projects.
Assist with the design and implementation of training programs for associated on the newer enhanced processes.
Assist in planning, developing and executing test plans.
Maintain issue logs, tracks/follows up on problems.
Provide knowledge transfer and feedback as appropriate.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Communicate effectively with business users to identify needs and evaluate alternative business solutions with project management.
Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction.
Check out some of the required qualifications we are looking for in amazing candidates….
Bachelor's Degree (Master's preferred) in Supply Chain, Logistics Management, Business Administration and/or equivalent work experience.
Strong technical skills in terms of SQL, Crystal and BI tools is a must; also advanced knowledge of Excel, VBA and Macros would be very beneficial.
Strong experience in extracting/mining and modeling data; process mapping and root causing.
Prefer 2-4 years of equivalent work experience defining and implementing business process improvements in supply chain management systems and warehouse management.
Excellent project management skills; ability to manage multiple projects in time bound fashion; 1-2 full project life cycle implementations and go-lives required.
Knowledge of current best practices in Supply Chain Optimization, Transportation and Distribution.
Self-starter who takes initiative and can work with minimal supervision.

PRINCIPLE OF DUTIESAND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Children & Family Services Data Specialist is responsible for the coordination of all data, record keeping and ensuring documentation as it relates to the data is compliant with federal and state guidelines. The Data Specialist needs to be able to work with a considerable degree of independence, judgment and initiative; and performs related work as required. coordinates with: Head Start and Early HS staff, Student Transit, parents and community partners. All communications are potentially sensitive and are subject to Head Start’s, DCFS and PLCCA’s policy on confidentiality.
SUMMARY STATEMENT OF PRIMARY FUNCTIONS:
1. Serves as Data Specialist to the Children & Family Services Division. Conducts business via the phone in a pleasant, helpful and professional manner. Accurately prepares necessary reports; Coordinates and maintains the Eligibility, Recruitment, Selection, Enrollment and Attendance procedures and efforts for Head Start. Maintains a broad knowledge of department and program policies and procedures. Maintains physical and electronic files for the department. Assist Director in monitoring budget expenditures and processes purchase requests and claims.
2. Develops expertise and utilizes all Head Start/Early Head Start/Childcare program software systems with accuracy and assures timely completion of data entry for all required program elements
3. Enters a variety of program related data in program software information systems.
4. Maintains integrity of all program software information system by troubleshooting, problem solving and applying current updates.
5. Runs reports to verify accuracy of data entry.
6. Develops, coordinates and produces weekly, monthly, and annual reports as needed by the program for management, state and federal reporting requirements.
7. Works independently with minimal supervision.
8. Maintains strict confidentiality regarding program, student and parent information.
9. Maintains excellent organizational skills.
10. Establishes and maintains effective working and public relationships.
11. Maintains accurate and complete records in a timely manner.
12. Ability to interpret and communicate departmental and program policies, rules and regulations.
14. Ability to effectively use standard and company computer programs.
15. Ability to compose letters and prepare clear and detailed reports and written procedures.
17. Ability to take and edit public and departmental meeting notes.
18. Considerable knowledge of business English, spelling and composition.
19. Ability and desire to work in a team atmosphere.
20. Must be able to adapt to change and flexible
21. Ability to monitor the financial obligations of the department.
22. Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree or Associates Degree in business or related field. Recent Data Specialist experience and training; including high level of experience in Microsoft Office applications; experience in dealing with a diverse population of staff, parents and the public
Knowledge of computer programs; bi-lingual skills; preferred experience in Head Start/Early Head Start as a parent, employee or volunteer.
Must be vaccinated for COID-19 per Head Start/PLCCA mandate or qualify for an exemption waiver
Benefits
Paid Vacation, sick time and holidays. Health Insurance and 401(k)
