Tau Six, an agile small company delivering cutting edge cybersecurity and systems integration services to the US National Security market, has an immediate need for a Data Ontology Practitioner for a Department of Defense customer. In this role you have the opportunity to help our customer define, and migrate to, a data-driven organization with real-world impacts to national security.

CLEARANCE REQUIRED: Active Top Secret/SCI US Government clearance
The Data Ontology Practitioner discovers and categorizes the organization's data, and identifies relationships within data to provide leadership with objective information derived from the use of scientific, mathematical, and statistical principles. The results of this data will be used for making data-driven decisions regarding the governance, investment, and programmatic aspects of Tau Six customers' programs. The goal is to assist our customers as they evolve into an interconnected data-driven organization.

This position develops ontologies for customer data across a variety of domains and helps them apply knowledge representation techniques to draw insights from large sets of structured and unstructured data.
Responsibilities:
Your primary responsibility will be to build ontologies that help Tau Six customers understand their data and make data-driven mission critical decisions
Engage stakeholders from across the Department of Defense to determine ontology requirements
Work with subject matter experts to craft ontology content
Identifying and publishing data tagging and classification standards for national security program data
Analyzing a variety of data sources to provide data-driven insights to the organization to streamline processes
Identify, process, label, parse, and index unstructured, semi-structured, and structured classified and unclassified data sets
Provide data project management (including identifying, collecting, cleaning and preparing data) and creating, structuring, and maintaining data sets
Determining the best and most efficient ways to collect quantitative information
Developing data required for use in the management and direction of programs
Establishing systems of classification, data taxonomies, and coding
Defining useful measurements for cybersecurity and information system programs
Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems

Qualifications:
Possess a Bachelor's degree
4+ years of experience within the Information Technology career field
Have excellent written and oral communication skills, and the ability to work with a wide range of collaborators
Have experience building domain ontologies
Have experience with formal representations of logical reasoning and inference
Have experience with multi- or intra-disciplinary collaboration
Experience supporting U.S. Federal Government customers, ideally the Department of Defense
Desired Qualifications:
A bachelor's degree (Computer Science, Cognitive Science, Mathematics, Logic, or Linguistics preferred)
4+ years of experience within the Information Technology career field, with 2+ years experience in a data analysis / data science related position
Experience building domain ontologies based on a top-level ontology
Experience applying ontologies in natural language processing, image processing, or in the normalization/integration of heterogeneous data sources.
Coursework in data structures, databases, metaphysics, knowledge representation, algorithms, mathematical logic, mereotopology, or software programming
Experience with data visualization tools, such as D3.js, GGplot, etc.
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive, Pig
Experience with NoSQL databases, such as MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase

job title: Continuous Learning & Data Coach- Community/Home Based
job description:
Position Summary
This position provides training for their team to support educational and family development services, deepen reflective practice and build and apply data utilization expertise. Partners with teams across the organization to implement the organization’s programs, projects and initiatives with integrity and accountability. The Continuous Learning and Data Coach is a highly effective leader who coaches a teaching team to develop their ability to effectively deliver instruction and increase successful student and family outcomes.
Key Responsibilities & Duties
Student Development & Management
Coaches teaching team to develop their knowledge, skills, and abilities to increase successful student and family outcomes.
Oversees the development and implementation of programs and strategies through curriculum, assessment, and data utilization;
Coaches internal and external teams to utilize appropriate curriculum using a research-based coaching model that emphasizes the analysis and application of child and program quality data to improve the delivery of instruction and other services to achieve targeted child, family and program outcomes
Ensures that ethnic and cultural backgrounds are appropriately recognized and integrated into the curriculum, classroom socializations, programs, and services; provides opportunities for cultural competency development activities
Ensures Educare Learning Network core features are implemented and maintained
Utilizes an interdisciplinary approach to support stakeholders in improving family outcomes as they coach parents to use developmentally appropriate educational, parenting, and problem-solving strategies, and guide families toward self-sufficiency
Monitors the delivery of systematic and integrated comprehensive program services to ensure students are school ready as defined in the school readiness goals and developmental framework
Influences and supports parents’ involvements as the primary teacher of their students
Program & Curriculum Compliance
Ensures program operations and compliance with all applicable quality standards which may include HIPPY USA Model Standards, Head Start and Early Head Start Performance Standards, ITERs NAEYC Standards, Educare Core Competencies, Qualistar Rating, CCAP, as well as state and local regulations
Contributes to year-long training development plan and provides staff professional learning (when relevant) in their area(s) of expertise.
Ensures EHS and HS grant requirements, reports and evaluations are met and completed within timeframe outlined in the grants
Cultivate a departmental (remove departmental) culture of data usage for continuous learning to improve performance and innovation and strategically collaborate with organizational workgroups focused on continuous quality improvement to enact process and outcome improvement projects
Supports the planning process of lead teachers as they prepare for collaboration among their teams and professional learning experiences;
Identifies 2-3 model classrooms or learning labs for teachers to observe effective instructional practice
Reviews monthly monitoring and tracking reports to ensure quality benchmarks are met including lesson plans, assessments, screenings, home-visits, parent-teacher conferences, child/family reviews, Family Partnership Agreements (FPAs), attendance, performance standard requirements and the implementation of quality services for students and families
Ensures team is using data driven dialogue and decision making to inform their practice both internally and with families
Monitors compliance of regulations and works with internal stakeholders to implement changes to compliance standards
Tracks and monitors all program funding sources per contract or grant requirements
Reviews current program materials including forms, tools, documentation, etc. and compares against compliance and regulations
Maintains working knowledge of crisis and intervention offerings, health requirements and partnerships
Department & Team Collaboration
Develops and provides ongoing quality improvement opportunities for their team and cultivates a coaching relationship that advances best practice skills and competencies
Builds and maintains positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders at all levels including employees, students, families, and visitors
Collaborates with internal stakeholders to provide opportunities for professional growth and classroom training; disseminates pertinent training program information and materials to their team
Diagnose staff needs using assessment data and observations to implement a continuous learning cycle
Engages their team in continuous improvement/reflective inquiry through a formal coaching cycle, and equips staff to pursue professional development and individual education goals as delineated on their professional development plans
Attends training sessions, events, and meetings to meet the needs of their position and department
Qualifications
Education
Masters Degree in Social Work, Early Childhood Education, or a related field preferred
Certifications or Licenses
Department of Human Services Child Care Center Director
Pediatric CPR & First Aid Certification
Valid Driver’s License
Experience
3 years required
Area of relevant experience: Social work, administration, or coaching experience in an early childhood related setting
Other Special Requirements
Current PPD-TB and physical examination
Successfully pass a Colorado Bureau of Investigation and Federal Bureau of Investigation criminal background checks
Pass a National Sex Offender Registry Check
Bilingual in Spanish preferred
Skills & Abilities
Strong compassion for children with the ability to interact with children and families in a positive manner
*
Knowledge of economic, cultural, and societal challenges of ethnically diverse communities
Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to interpret and understand information received and prepare and transmit
Serve as a trusted partner within their team and the organization
Ability to adapt to the needs of the organization; demonstrated ability to work effectively with different teams
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail; time management skills with a proven ability to meet multiple deadlines
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and ability to learn new systems; ability to perform and apply basic mathematical computations
Ability to identify conflict and take necessary steps to resolve issues; can remain calm under stressful conditions
Comprehensive and up-to-date knowledge of related function and regulations; ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality

Full Time, Flexible weekday schedule. 36 hours/week.
Pay Range is between $23.21-$34.80/hr, depending on years of relevant and like experience.
Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100th anniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.
POSITION SUMMARY
Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.
JOB QUALIFICATIONS
Education or Formal Training
Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.
Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)
Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.
Knowledge, Skill and Ability
Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.
Experience
At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Assists in developing and maintaining cancer program standards by ACoS/COC and NAPBC.
Coordinates maintenance of appropriate files, reports and other cancer related data to ensure approval standards by the American College of Surgeons and the Colorado State Cancer Registry. Preparing graphs and statistics.
Prepares cancer reports and statistical data of the cancer program and breast center activities to administration, physician, outside agencies and/or Colorado State Cancer Registry.
Develops and implement changes in cancer registry policies and procedures to ensure CoC and NAPBC requirements
Monitors quality data (including periodic audits) to ensure data quality and compliance with state and CoC and NAPBC requirements.
Coordinates, plans, attends, documents, and promotes attendance at all Tumor Conferences.
Schedules a minimum of 4 Cancer Committee meetings a year on the medical staff calendar.
Drafts Cancer Committee agendas to represent each standard outlined by the ACOS. Allocate time on the agenda for each coordinator and specialty to give report, at the designated intervals required by the ACOS, if not more often.
Serves as a member of the Cancer Committee.
Coordinates Cancer Registry abstractors and oversight of all of their encompassing cancer registry activities.
About Boulder Community Health and Boulder, Colorado
Uncompromising medical excellence delivered with respect and compassion. Since 1922, Boulder Community Health has built a strong reputation on these values. As community-owned and operated not-for-profit hospital and clinic locations, we remain dedicated to the evolving needs of our citizens and providing access to high-quality care. Nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains, the Boulder lifestyle is conductive to enjoying the outdoors and brings a fresh perspective to healthcare practice. Surround yourself by natural beauty and an active, life-embracing community. Enjoy state-of-the-art facilities and equipment along with competitive compensation and benefits, including health/dental/life, tuition reimbursement, on-site fitness center, Employee Wellness, Employee Activities & Discounts, and many more!

Location: Boulder Community Health · Oncology Services Admin
Schedule: Full-time, Days - 8 hour shifts, M - F, flexible schedule

Reports to: Vice President, Financial Analysis

Primary Functions: Assists in eliciting business requirements, designing, building and supporting the components of the data warehouse (data models, metadata, ETL). Assist power users in creating and maintaining reports and dashboards to deliver business intelligence to the organization. Assist in developing governance processes around data management.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Works with Business users and domain SMEs to understand requirements.
Assists in maintaining data models (dimensional models with conformed dimensions, entity relational models), and Data Vault models to satisfy analytics requirements.
Assist in building ETL processes to load and reconcile data in the warehouse.
Assists in data mapping activities by specifying logic and business rules for transforming and preparing data.
Provides assistance and support to the development and publication of reports and dashboards.
Assists with Data Quality (DQ) and Master Data Management (MDM) initiatives.
Assists in developing governance processes around data management and the warehouse development.
Develops knowledge of credit union operations and knowledge of current industry trends as well as current methods and technologies that relate to Data Warehousing, data preparation, data presentation practices and operations.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field.

Creditable Experience in Lieu of Education: Minimum of three years progressive experience in data modeling (dimensional and ER), data vaults, and / or SQL for creating data stores, data marts and data warehouses.

Experience/Skills: Strong oral, written, administrative, organizational and inter-personal skills. The ability to analyze problems, develop alternatives and recommendations. Proficiency in converting analytical requirements into dimensional models (star schema, snowflakes, conformed dimensions, etc.), familiarity with scripting languages (python, PowerShell, etc.). Experience with data base design and loading and reconciling data in a SQL warehouse. Proficiency in SQL and self-service analytics tools such as Excel, Power Pivot, YellowFin, Snowflake, PowerBI, Tableau etc. Proficient in developing SSAS cubes and tabular models and SSRS reports. Familiarity with Visual Studio, TFS and SSIS. Familiarity with Master Data Management, data quality tools, data integration tools, R, and Python is desired. Financial Services experience and familiarity of big data concepts is a plus.

Enter and verify data into standardized systems

Search for, categorize, and enter data from multiple departments and sources
Review documents and records for completeness and accuracy

Process all requests according to established intake processes and internal guidelines

Ability to exhibit & apply technical hardware knowledge with Workstations like Windows Laptops, Mac Laptops, and Towers
Strong teamwork and communication/information sharing skills
Exercise judgment and influence on key process and technical decisions (for example, policy, standards, technical solutions)
Good organization, planning, and time management skills
Demonstrated ability to manage complexity and handle/prioritize multiple tasks
Process oriented
Excellent written and verbal skills

About the Job
As a Data Analytics Manager you will be responsible for the development and growth of the analytics function at TN Marketing along with others in the analytics area. Your area will be responsible for providing an array of insights from analyzing online customer data, marketing campaigns, website engagement, as well as solve complex data problems, all with the ultimate goal of growing our online business.
This job is unique in that he or she will work at a peer level with the entire digital team, working with social media, paid media, search engine optimization (SEO), Search Engine Marketing (SEM), Web Development, and Web analytics staff to produce campaign analyses. You will play a crucial role in the management of our digital marketing campaigns in an effort to grow our business through effective use of data and marketing campaigns. You will work with internal stakeholders to identify Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) using defined business objectives and goals, planning website and campaign metrics to support the KPIs, and designing custom dashboards to track and report results.
In this role you will also work with others on the analytics team to drive forward TN Marketing’s capabilities in the creation, management and implementation of data warehousing and data management in terms of data capture, storage, organization, enhancement and advanced analytics. You will help standardize and create efficiencies in data capture, updates, extraction and utilization while developing and leveraging a deep understanding of TN Marketing’s customer data.
Job Responsibilities (include but not limited to)
· Develop and execute campaign analysis, ad-hoc analysis, metrics, design of complex projects as well as articulation of insights and analysis to internal stakeholders.
· Enhance and build on existing web-based and app-based analytics, site testing, and consumer engagement online tracking.
· Oversight and interpretation of results in business context with detailed findings, implications and present to all stakeholders. Design and lead effective presentations and communicate significant business value derived from each business engagement to clients.
· Report building and measurement, testing and segmentation strategy, generating insights and recommendations.
· Assist the marketing team with strategic planning processes, work with them to identify analytical needs and solutions and provide analytical data services to support marketing spend decisions.
· Work with SVP Business Planning & Analytics to determine and implement data warehousing and data management strategies in terms of data capture, storage, organization, updates, enhancement, extraction and analytics.
· Analyze, review and report on effectiveness of our online communities.
· Continually explore, optimize and recommend ways to increase traffic, drive conversions, improve website engagement and lower customer acquisition cost.
· Develop and maintain expertise with all business intelligence software applications as a means to analyze data, derive and produce insight, and present to stakeholders.
· Ability to build financial projection models based on key metric and core KPIs of the business.
· Familiarity with building lifetime value analysis and assessment of ROI/IRR based on various customer acquisition channels and costs.
· Develop and document processes and procedures for working with and providing deliverables to internal data customers. Perform other specially assigned projects and tasks according to instructions and requirements of management. Projects must be completed in accordance with indicated deadlines and expectations.
Desired Skills and Experience
· Bachelor's degree in an analytically oriented discipline (e.g. business, economics, statistics, mathematics, etc.) or technology oriented discipline (e.g. computer science, MIS, etc.).
· 3+ years of experience with a proven and successful track record of meeting aggressive performance goals.
· Genuine passion for online marketing and a strong understanding of online optimization, and ROI analysis is a plus.
· Strong knowledge of database tools including SQL (T-SQL) and MS SQL Server (SSMS) is required; knowledge of statistical modeling software (SPSS, SAS) is a plus.
· Knowledge of business intelligence and data visualization software, such as Tableau, Microstrategy, MS PowerBI or similar is a plus.
· Experience in web analytics with tools such as Google Analytics (G4), SiteCatalyst, KISSmetrics, Bright Edge, WebTrends, or CoreMetrics is preferred.
· Deep expertise and ability to build and analyze databases, relational database concepts; and the ability to analyze and present data in multiple platforms.
· Proven knowledge of key marketing statistical principles including data modeling, segmentation, and analysis.
· Experience with conversion funnels and email marketing required.
About TN Marketing
At TN Marketing, we develop market, manage and deliver countless hours of compelling video content that engages a wide variety of audiences with special interests. Our team of experts is known for its innovation, creativity, and most of all, its ability to deliver professional quality, branded instructional video content to passionate hobbyists of all sorts – from avid quilters to savvy woodworkers – and beyond. Additionally, we believe that affinity-oriented paid subscription channels are the future of online content. With an unparalleled track record of delivering amazing content online, we’re media trendsetters at monetizing video content. But our capabilities don’t stop there…

ABOUT US
Agilify is a minority woman owned boutique consultancy in Baton Rouge, LA focused on delivering strategy, process, technology and training services. Our mission is to create a culture of inclusion, transparency, and accountability for our employees and client partners by delivering outcomes that are valuable to their growth.
BUSINESS ANALYST JOB SUMMARY
We are currently seeking a detail-oriented Business Analyst to join our growing firm. In this role, you will document business requirements, develop detailed design documents, facilitate configuration changes, develop test plans, and conduct user acceptance testing and training required to support the Division of Medical Quality Assurance, Bureau of Operations.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Facilitate collecting system requirements with the business program staff as assigned by the Department.
Develop documentation as assigned by the Department (i.e., diagrams, flow charts, requirements documents).
Perform needs analysis, analyze business processes, develop process maps, and assist project managers in all phases of the projects as assigned by the Department.
Develop test cases and test plans.
Perform testing on system changes to meet user-defined requirements.
Facilitate user acceptance testing (UAT) with the business program staff.
Facilitate meetings with technical and program staff as assigned by the Department (i.e., schedule meetings, document decisions, identify issues and action items).
Produce status reports on the implementation of user-defined requirements as assigned by the Department.
Produce detailed accounting of hours worked by tasks as assigned by the Department.
Follow DOH IT processes and coordinate with other DOH IT staff to ensure compliance with DOH standards as assigned by the Department.
Correspond (verbally and in written formats) with project teams and internal stakeholders regarding project activities, deliverables, and status as assigned by the Department.
Actively participate in project status meetings as assigned by the Department.
Coordinate efforts with the Contract Manager to achieve cost savings under this agreement, where feasible and practicable, as assigned by the Department. Those efforts include, but are not limited to, identifying common system errors in systems that can be resolved in a manner that achieves cost savings in the State of Florida.
Any cost savings identified must be documented and included as part of the monthly status report.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in business, technology, or a related field.
Scrum, Agile or CBAP™ certification preferred.
Experienced with agile/scrum concepts, scrum events, artifacts, and values.
Experience conducting cost-benefit analysis and strategic business process modeling.
Strong leadership abilities.
Critical thinking, analytical, and problem-solving proficiency.
Five years of experience with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) methodologies and documentation.
Five years of experience with Microsoft Project, Excel, Word, SharePoint, PowerPoint, and Visio.
Five years of experience with creating and presenting internal and external status reports and detailed status reports suitable for presentation to the management team.
Five years of experience with meeting facilitation and documentation.
Four years of experience implementing, integrating with, or maintaining MicroPact’s Versa Online and/or Versa Regulation products.
Five years of experience with leading meetings and determining work tasks that need to be completed.
Six years of experience with delivering the project in the agreed schedule, to the correct technical specification (i.e. defined to meet user requirements) within the approved budget or other specified criteria.
Strong ability to analyze opportunities & problems, recommend solutions, and communicate effectively & confidently (both verbal and written).
Effective communication, listening, influencing, and collaboration skills.
Positive, team-oriented attitude and passion towards testing/quality.
EDUCATION AND RELEVENT WORK EXPERIENCE

As the nation’s leading bottled water company, BlueTriton Brands is dedicated to providing customers with healthy hydration options. Alongside that, we’re also committed to developing our people – enabling them to make the most of the many elements that help them to succeed. It’s a chance to use your knowledge, skills and experience to shine brightly and achieve your ambitions – all while delivering healthy hydration to millions of customers.
When it comes to leading the industry with the highest standards in quality, BlueTriton Corporate is a vital element of our success. Whether you’re based in finance or Human Resources, Legal, Communications or IT, you’ll be a force for good – someone who is trusted, empowered and supported to make a genuine, lasting impression on our organization.
Job Description

This role is based out of our Stamford, CT HQ with a hybrid work schedule (3 days a week in office).

The Director, Enterprise Data Governance reports to the CFO, Product Supply and Business Services and is responsible for providing strategic enterprise data governance leadership across all BlueTriton Brands data domains. This critical role leads the SAP Enterprise Data Management (EDM) team partnering closely with BTB Leadership teams, Data Domain Directors, Business Functional Leaders, and EDM Digital Technology teams to implement and drive improved data quality, data integrity, and data governance.

In this role you will be responsible for day-to-day operational execution of data governance priorities aligned with digital technology deliverables, including data policies and best practices aimed at achieving the required level of consistency, accuracy, validity, and completeness of enterprise data.

Role And Responsibilities
Develop a vision and strategy for data governance across the enterprise including implementing a data governance framework.
Chair Data Governance Steering Committee responsible for defining data policies and standards
Develop the SAP Data Governance framework including role definitions and accountabilities, charters, progress dashboards, published minutes, decision logs, change controls, data issue management and policies.
Serve as the product leader for metadata management and data quality capabilities, including data cataloging, data lineage, and data quality monitoring
Lead Business Process Management and process modeling governance enterprise wide
Implement data governance strategy, controls, and capabilities including data catalog, metadata management, data quality certification, data quality metrics, reference data management, data domain hierarchy and taxonomy management, reporting and analytics governance, data classification and tagging, data architecture, and data modeling
Design and deliver a data literacy program to educate executives and functional teams on importance of data and drive a data driven organizational culture
Manage stakeholder communication and progress reporting at various levels of the organization including leadership and executives
Participate in development of SAP master data management strategies, implementation roadmaps and business cases.
Promote lean mindset as it pertains to the team’s operational effectiveness and opportunities to continuously improve data quality and data governance across the enterprise.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university or college.
Minimum 10 years technology experience in SAP data governance, SAP Master Data Management (MDM), and data quality technologies.
Minimum 10 years Business Operations
Desired Skills
Ability to lead in a highly matrixed environment
Demonstrated continuous improvement experiences
Passionate about driving change and influence transformational change.
Ability to work with cross functional teams to drive operationalization of data governance and data quality products
Hands on experience in solving challenges for master data management, data quality problems or complex data integrations.
Key understanding of the importance of change management in the implementation of data and information management strategies
Ability to manage stakeholder communication and progress reporting at various levels of the organization including leadership and executives
Models’ humility, transparency, and delivers with focus
#LI-Hybrid
BlueTriton Brands is the nation’s leading bottled water company. Our water brands include Poland Spring, Arrowhead, Ozarka, Deer Park, Zephyrhills, Ice Mountain, Origins, Saratoga, Splash, Ac+ion and Pure Life. We’re passionate about creating shared value for society in all kinds of ways: from providing careers and benefits to communities where we operate to environmental stewardship – most notably responsible water management, lightweight packaging and advancing recycling in America. As a valuable part of our team, you’ll receive a competitive total rewards package – something that will provide you with the support you need to thrive both inside and outside of work. It’s not just the work that you’ll find fulfilling here though. As you build a career with us, you’ll receive exactly the kind of benefits you’d expect from a leading name in healthy hydration. The only question is, what elements will help you succeed at BlueTriton Brands?
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

job title: Marketing Database Specialist, Mardi Gras Casino
job description:
The Opportunity
Delaware North Gaming is searching for a Marketing Database Specialist to join our team at Mardi Gras Casino in Cross Lanes, West Virginia. As a Marketing Database Specialist you will be responsible for continuous analysis of the player and customer database and using your findings to assist with development and implementation of all marketing and players club promotional activity for gaming operations.
Minimum – Anticipated Maximum Salary: $43300 - $57400 / year
The advertised pay range represents what we believe at the time of this job posting, that we would be willing to pay for this position. Only in special circumstances, where a candidate has education, training, or experience that far exceeds the requirements for the position, would we consider paying higher than the stated range. Information on our comprehensive benefits package can be found at https://careers.delawarenorth.com/whatweoffer.

At Delaware North, we care about our team member’s personal and professional journeys. These are just some of the benefits we offer:
Health, dental, and vision insurance
401(k) with company match
Performance bonuses
Paid vacation days and holidays
Paid parental bonding leave
Tuition and/or professional certification reimbursement
Generous friends-and-family discounts at many of our hotels and resorts
Responsibilities
Administer and update analysis by combining data from different key database sources.
Continuous detailed analysis of player database to identify opportunities for increased revenue, market share, and spend efficiency that may be achieved with targeted marketing efforts.
Facilitate implementation, tracking, and reporting of all marketing activities through a defined schedule of regular reports. Present results with potential action items.
Develop predictive modeling utilizing historical data for promotional effectiveness and labor needs.
Pro forma and postforma development for evaluation of all marketing initiatives. Forecast weekly future promotional calendar effectiveness against prior year and planned levels.
Coordinate list management and queries for direct mail and email recipients under provided guidelines. Work with mail house, print shop and internal email resources to ensure accuracy of data provided.
Collaborate with state gaming commission.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Excellent math and analytical skills. Must be able to analyze data from various angles and offer all viewpoints for review.
Proficient in SQL. Must be able to create reporting in Excel from data obtained through SQL.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a state gaming license..
Weekends, holidays and swing shift work may be required.
Bachelor's degree in marketing, statistics, or related field preferred.
Who We Are
Delaware North operates Mardi Gras Casino and Resort dating back to 2018. Located 14 miles west of Charleston, West Virginia, Mardi Gras features more than 25 table games, a poker room, more than 850 slot machines, live greyhound racing, and off-track betting for both greyhound and horse racing; several restaurants and a 150-room hotel.
At Delaware North, you’ll love where you work, who you work with, and how your day unfolds. Whether it’s in sporting venues, casinos, airports, national parks, iconic hotels, or premier restaurants, there’s no telling where your career can ultimately take you. We empower you to do great work in a company with 100 years of success, stability and growth. If you have drive and enjoy the thrill of making things happen - share our vision and grow with us.
Delaware North Companies, Incorporated and its subsidiaries consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. Delaware North is an equal opportunity employer.

THIS POSITION REQUIRES WASHINGTON STATE RESIDENCY
Summary / Objective:
This position provides senior level development and support for Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) processes and utilities, including testing, implementing and maintaining EDI transactions. The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will leverage industry best practices, evaluate current state, and recommend, develop, implement and support new EDI vision and supporting processes. The position plays a key role in PSW’s strategy and will lead efforts in modernizing and rebuilding the EDI environment to support substantial growth. This position is expected to proactively identify opportunities to utilize technology to solve technical and business problems.
The Senior EDI Technical Analyst will analyze, evaluate and collaborate in the redesign of business, IT or operational processes and leads communications with trading partners for EDI transaction set-up and ongoing maintenance and support. The position monitors, resolve / troubleshoot and oversees scheduling of daily batch production jobs including job scheduling as required, maintaining accurate records of all production processing, problem resolution/escalation, and daily request processing. This position will conduct secure transfer of information to and from outside vendors.
Essential Functions:
· Replace manual and legacy procedures with industry best practices to support automation at scale and PSW’s long term strategy.
· Collaborates with others to understand current processes and create new processes and procedures.
Serves as primary resource of knowledge and experience as a technical contact for internal and external stakeholders on any EDI-related issue.
Monitors, audits and maintains interfaces between business systems to include interface between internal and external partners with key focus on Electronic Data Interface (EDI) processes.
Diagnoses EDI process problems of a complex nature, coordinating with other technical and/or business resources as necessary for assistance.
Leads company’s effort to define requirements for EDI applications.
Designs, develops, tests, and implements new software applications and EDI programs, maps, and processes through entire life cycle.
Independently participates in requirements documentation, business systems configuration and defining/execution of acceptance criteria. Document issues and participate in their resolution.
Oversees EDI & batch processes day-to-day to identify and address problems as they arise and to track levels of activity, compiling and tracking metrics for senior management.
Designs, configures, installs and maintains solutions for the administration of production system batch processes, including setup, configuration, installation and scheduling.
Responsible for creating best practices for related systems with supporting documentation and standard operating procedures.
Work closely with other teams to remediate all EDI issues, i.e. (server, network, database, etc.)
Works on prioritized incidents, enhancements, projects, code deployments, application upgrades, and performance testing support.
Participates in the IT Change Management process to lead, schedule and support EDI related changes.
Competencies:
Solid understanding of the EDI needs and processes of both small and large organizations with the ability to implement best-of-breed, enterprise-class solutions to support rapid growth.
Ability to document standard operating procedures and best practice to support environment of continuous improvement.
Working knowledge of EDI Formats: ANSI X12 (834, 837P/I, 835, 270/271, 276/277, 278N/R), XML, HC7, FHIR, and proprietary formats
Meticulous attention to detail; the ability to juggle several tasks in parallel without lowering your quality bar.
Proficient in creating, developing and producing mapping documents.
Solid understanding of business requirements and ability to apply supporting solutions.
Ability to translate business needs into high-level technical specifications and design.
Working knowledge of EDI configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment.
Working knowledge of file transfer protocols including HTTPs, FTP, SFTP.
Knowledge of state, federal and local regulations concerning use, disclosure and confidentiality of all patient records including a strong knowledge of the HIPAA Privacy and Security Act.
Required Education and/or Work Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience is required.
5+ years of experience directly related and progressively responsible experience in EDI systems, preferably in a healthcare environment.
6 + years of experience in the development and/or support of software systems are required.
3+ years related experience including developing requirements, designing and executing test cases in IT
Hands-on X12 health care insurance transaction (834, 837, 270, 271, 999 etc.) data mapping and issue resolution experience
Experience with SQL, relational databases and Microsoft development tools, such as VB, VB Script, .NET or ASP.
Experience with QA methodology and problem-solving techniques/tools.
Experience with multi-tiered client-server and web-based applications.
Experience with working with developers and internal technical teams to develop and test EDI processes.
Preferred Education and/or Work Experience:
Knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid.
Experience creating EDI processes “from the ground up” in a small to mid-sized organization.
Experience with applying Agile Methods.
Experience with healthcare claims and billing file types.
Experience with Citra EZ-CAP or similar systems.
Understanding of health industry diagnosis, procedure and revenue codes and their application.
Experience writing complex SQL scripts.
Understanding of EDI 834 enrollment transactions, including Adds, Changes, Terminations, Cancellations, and error processing.

job title: IT - Sr. Business Analyst Data & Analytics
job description:
Summary
The DT&A Department of Louis Dreyfus Company is currently looking for a Senior Business Analyst for its Data & Analytics Service, to be based in Memphis. As part of a dynamic IT organization currently undergoing a transformational change, you will act as change booster and play a key role on business process transformation to enable innovative and faster decision-making processes driven by analytic application. We invite you to join our team if you aim to make the difference with your contribution and establish yourself as a key member of our IT organization.
Main responsibilities
*Must be authorized to work for all U.S. employers.*
What will be your mission:
Establish a relationship with your business partners to analyze and understand their data and analytics needs, searching for opportunities to improve and transform business processes
You will be a key contributor for the successful deployment of various Data & Analytics products for the region/platform
You will be the change agent in charge of reviewing and deploying the process transformation on various Data & Analytics products for the region/platform
What will be your duties & responsibilities:
Management of your solutions/products’ scope, processes and stakeholders
Monitor adoption measures for processes and applications in your area and propose corrective actions when necessary
Ensure agile product backlog, roll outs, continuous improvement plan and deployments are defined and constantly updated in sync with the global Business Intelligence strategy
Ensure support structure is in place for your products and become the “go to person” for traders users’ community driving adoption and removing roadblocks to effectively embed analytics solutions in business processes
Responsible for gathering and translating business requirements into detailed function specifications and managing requests for changes
Own the delivery of parts of the projects or programs in your scope and its associated metrics on time and on budget
Ensure products’ deliverables are properly documented and with adequate reference material
Highlight to solution manager implementation constraints you may sport as well as dependency with other solutions
Provide management with accurate and timely status reports of all projects/scope as assigned
Assist business partners in determining how business requirements are integrated into business processes and generate expected outcomes
Work closely with the business owners of your application/solution being the intermediary between them and our external delivery partners to develop or support your data and analytics products
Support business partners in the test phases and organize training sessions as required
Learn all core technologies in the data and analytics portfolio and how to build reports and analytics applications starting from data using them proficiently
Experience
Previous Experiences required:
3-5 years of proven experience in a business analyst type of role in IT projects implementation
Project management experience in small to medium size projects being able to report status and potential risks
Previous experience in commodities trading domain on middle office or controlling processes will be considered a strong plus (Position Reporting, Daily P&L, Execution, Risk Exposure etc.)
Previous experience in KPIs definition and storytelling visual analytics implementation will be considered a strong plus
Previous experience in a client facing role will be considered a plus
Experience in a multi-cultural environment
Other skills (computer skills, datascience...)

Position Overview:
This position is primarily responsible for working with the Lines of Business (LOB) Subject Matter Experts to translate LOB problems into requirements, process changes, test cases, data mapping, etc. The incumbent manages/assists with updating/creating business requirements, process documentation, data mapping extracts and test plans and manages/assists with user acceptance testing. The incumbent works with the project managers to complete and update project documentation and deliverables and provides expert input and best practice guidance on areas of subject matter expertise.

Summary
The Data Analytics Specialist, under the general direction of the Director of Information Technology, and in accordance with good business practices and established procedures, will gather, manage, analyze, and report data from internal Organ Procurement Organization (OPO) systems and external industry systems. Analyze data to establish baseline performance metrics. Produce internal and external reports and assist with publication initiatives. Make recommendations for process improvement initiatives. Provide continuous monitoring of local donation activity data and regular reports to leadership. Promote efficiency throughout the organization utilizing creative and innovative thinking to develop, analyze and verify statistical measures.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Responsible for the integrity and quality of data within the Information Technology (IT) infrastructure to support operations, management and decision-making. Actively participate in cross departmental initiatives ensuring data is efficiently organized, managed and distributed. Enable strategic use of enterprise-wide information for cross-functional organizations and teams.
Provide data related services throughout the organization. Consult with leadership and workforce on process measures, evaluation techniques, as well as, current and potential IT related solutions.
Verify organ and tissue donor statistics in the electronic medical record system while using analytical tools.
Assist with process improvement where data or IT infrastructure is integral to the improvement. Monitors and participate in the compilation of OPO quality measures.
Ensure data collection processes are consistent, repeatable, and appropriate throughout the organization.
Assist with internal and external reporting requests and requirements.
Validates and analyzes various data, metrics, and information via business intelligence (BI), statistical and quality tools.
Analyze all organ and tissue recovery data and produces reports regarding activity, outcome, and recommended improvement areas.
Assist with the tracking of organizational metrics to support the success of the organization’s strategic efforts.
Facilitates team-based problem solving and multidisciplinary team use of various data-driven process improvement techniques such as Process Mapping and Root Cause Analysis. Applies business logic and ask questions that are not necessarily apparent.
Supports organizational survey processes with analysis, tracking and developing of survey data for both internal and external partners.
Develop and maintain specialized datasets and systems for recording and tracking appropriate data and statistical information.
Creates and distributes standardized and special reports, summaries, and analyses.
Organizes appropriate resources, organizational priorities and manages systems as related to data activities.
Maintains monthly scorecards and dashboards for the organization to ensure compliance with performance measures.
Integrates features and tools of Office 365 into the IT infrastructure.
Maintains a continuous and independent education on cutting-edge statistical techniques and tools.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications, Education & Experience

Bachelor’s Degree (preferred);
Minimum 2 of years’ experience in business analysis, and/or a quality improvement role;
Five years of experience with an organ and/or tissue procurement agency (preferred); or
An equivalent combination of education and experience.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy (required).
Ability to approach work conscientiously and methodically.
Ability to exercise initiative and sound judgment.
Understanding of basic statistics (required).
Demonstrated organizational skills required and ability to see tasks through to completion (required).
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work both independently and as part of a team (required).
Working knowledge of medical terminology and medical records/procedures (preferred).
Demonstrated knowledge of and ability using a Personal Computer (PC), related Microsoft Office software and other report writing and BI software.

Panther Systems is the leading provider of data, automation and advanced process control solutions for pulp, paper and nonwoven manufacturing. Becoming a great company took time and dedication, so we are patient and selective when it comes to growing our family.
Panther employs technicians, engineers and account managers — and we work well together. We celebrate one another’s personal and professional achievements, and we face challenges together.
We work hard and put in some extra hours, because we will never let down our customers. Still, we know why we work, and support one another to be there when our families need us. Our family-first outlook is the foundation for a positive workplace. Perhaps, this perspective is what makes coming to work something we look forward to doing again and again. Employees can grow personally and professionally, while contributing to the company's success.
Panther Systems offers employees paid personal days, 100% health coverage, 50% health coverage for dependents, 4% matching 401k, travel opportunities, access to the latest technologies and a family-first company philosophy.
The Position
Panther Systems Northwest is seeking a Database Administrator/Developer to join the team in Vancouver, WA. This team member's primary role is to deploy engineering changes into internal test systems, customer test systems and production environments. It will be vital to come up to speed quickly on existing database structure and be able to assist in performance and data access issues. Experience with GIT repos is required. Familiarity with Azure DevOps CI/CD, DacPac deployments and MS Visual Studio is preferred.
In this position, you will install Microsoft SQL onto servers, install databases on those servers, maintain the databases, deploy changes to structure over time to those databases, provide expert SQL advice to clients and help IT staff with server maintenance and troubleshoot slowness or fault issues as they arise. Other team members (Software Engineers) make required code changes by creating stored procedures, functions and views and committing them to a database project in the Azure DevOps environment, you then will review that work and suggest changes or approve the work. You will pull the proper version of the database from DevOps, create pull requests to submit changes into the different versions of the database, and then use tools to compare the branch structure to test platforms and create a change script that will be used to deploy to the test systems – both in-house and at the customer site and then into production at the customers’ site.
Responsibilities
Meets Project Goals by assessing project requirements and designing database solutions for efficiency, extensibility and performance; maintaining existing database systems by correcting errors, extending functionality and/or improving performance; working strategically with the Support Services team to support customers; supporting sales initiatives.
Contributes to measurable team and organizational objectives by collaborating with supervisors and mentoring peers on database development best practices and standards; provide guidance to junior peers on complex projects to learn through experience; following through with commitments and fostering mutual trust with co-workers.
Identifies database requirements by interviewing customers; analyzing department application, programming, and operations; evaluating existing systems and designing proposed systems.
Recommends database solution by defining database physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications.
Maintains database baselines by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
Contributes to team Cohesiveness by positively leading team members to make innovative contributions and embrace new ideas; sharing acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels; engaging junior co-workers to share knowledge and new techniques to resolve challenges.
Improves Communication by exemplifying active listening with co-workers; contributing appropriately during discussions; accurately preparing written business correspondence that is coherent, grammatically correct, effective, professional and engaging.
Meets Customer Service Requirements by providing technical support to internal customers (departments) as well as external customers.
Contributes to Product Effectiveness by assisting the System Test group in developing System Testing plans; carrying out the testing process when appropriate; following database baseline process to maintain ever fresh readiness.
Applies Techniques to Improve Code Quality, Consistency and Maintainability by preparing and leading code reviews, solving problems analytically and approaching challenges logically and systematically.
Supports Installation Process by recommending options and courses of action for solutions while participating in product installations at customer sites.
Builds and Strengthens Corporate/Department Reputation by working within a team as well as independently to achieve goals and deadlines for projects; exploring new opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
Provides Information by creating and maintaining system documentation, i.e. installation instructions, release notes, user manuals.
Protects Panther’s intellectual property by keeping information confidential.
Required Skills
Strong organizational skills, including the ability to multi-task, prioritize work, accuracy, and attention to detail.
Advanced customer facing skills.
Strong ability to quickly learn new tasks and willingness to accept new responsibilities.
Strong ability to communicate effectively and professionally with employees and customers. Good listening skills and the ability to clarify information and instructions.
Strong ability to use good judgement and discretion.
Strong ability to handle large workloads, balance priorities, and produce timely results.
Strong ability to express complex technical and abstract concepts effectively both verbally and in writing.
Ability to understand, read, write, and speak English clearly.
Valid driver’s license and ability to drive.
Advanced skills with Microsoft SQL Server 2012 or higher, including relational database performance tuning and maintenance.
Advanced skills with installing Microsoft SQL Server environments.
Advanced skills in data analysis and manipulation.
Advanced skills in query writing and debugging stored procedures and views.
Advanced skills in SSIS, Data Warehousing, BI techniques.
Confident using Windows OS and Microsoft Office Suite.
Knowledge of the entire software development life cycle.
Knowledge of the pulp and paper industry is a plus.
Additional Requirements
Potential Travel: ~10%
Driving record, insurance and personal finance must be satisfactory to book rental cars, flights and hotels in addition to dining on the road
Travel to unfamiliar locations, read maps and follow directions
Carry a mobile smartphone and laptop to remain accessible for on-call, after-hours or weekend remote support as needed
Work Flexibility: Hybrid - 3 days in office required, 2 days remote
Education and Experience
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent
Minimum of 5+ years of applicable database development
Some experience within the software solutions industry supporting pulp and paper operations is preferred
Military technical ratings and/or military experience desirable
Any equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience will be considered
Interpersonal Communication
You will communicate regularly with your supervisor, team members and customers, requiring detailed exchanges of information, documentation and problem solving.
Work Environment
This position requires the incumbent to work in a normal office environment with minimal exposure to hazards when not traveling. Normal travel conditions while traveling, with exposure to hazards associated with air and road transportation; lodging, food and water conditions; and weather and environmental conditions. Other work environment: occasional work in a paper mill environment and exposure to its associated hazards, requiring strict adherence to company and customer safety requirements. In mill environment, frequent exposure to high noise levels, dirt, dust and potentially dangerous equipment.

Full Time, Flexible weekday schedule. 36 hours/week.
Pay Range is between $23.21-$34.80/hr, depending on years of relevant and like experience.
Boulder Community Health is a Certified Level II Trauma Center. In 2022, we celebrated the 100th anniversary of the founding of our organization. We are honored to hold the awards of 2021 U.S. News & World ‘Best Hospitals for Maternity Care’, 2019 Best Medical Facility from Boulder Weekly, and Best Local Employer from Daily Camera. Come be part of an independent, community-focused health system; feel good knowing that your work will make a difference in people’s lives and positively contribute to the community.
POSITION SUMMARY
Coordinates the cancer data management system to promote quality care for the cancer patients at Boulder Community Health. Maintains compliance with the requirements for an approved cancer program and national accreditation program for breast centers set forth by the American College of Surgeons Commission on Cancer. Maintains compliance with the requirements for mandatory statewide reporting set forth by the Colorado Cancer Registry and Department of Public health.
JOB QUALIFICATIONS
Education or Formal Training
Accredited Record Technician (RHIT) or Registered Record Administrator (RHIA) preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required. ICD-9 Coding, cancer staging and word-processing. Expertise required with Excel spreadsheets and CNExT (or similar automated cancer registry system) ACOS web-based data upload process including but not limited to the National Call for Data (NCDB) and the Facility Identifiable data (FIPS level 1 & 2). State of Colorado Public Health and Environment compliance with state and federal laws mandating data collection and compliance in the research of those diagnosed with and treated for cancer. The Cancer Registry is responsible for guarding the hospitals compliance and fostering a cohesive relationship with the State liaisons and personnel and providing documentation to them upon request, to evidence the hospitals compliance with the state and federal statutes.
Special Qualifications (Licensure, Registration, etc.)
Bachelor or Associate Degree in health information technology are related field preferred. Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) required.
Knowledge, Skill and Ability
Knowledge of all American College of Surgeons and State of Colorado requirements for Cancer Registry accreditation process. Working knowledge of all levels of accreditation and evidence of experience with standards.
Evidence of ability to produce an annual report and comply with procedures for reporting to the state as required by American College of Surgeons.
Demonstrated ability for successful completion of ACOS accreditation survey.
Demonstrated excellent communication skills:
Writing ability including accurate grammar and spelling as evidenced by concise and clear report writing, compilation and organization of annual reports, preparation of tumor conference agendas, and synopses of data.
Verbal skills as evidenced by ability to communicate with all members of the health care team, the state tumor registry and patients when appropriate.
Demonstrated ability to execute a successful breast & cancer conference.
Demonstrated ability to accurately analyze and abstract patient records with an average time of 60 minutes or less per abstract.
Detail-oriented with ability to make independent decisions and use critical thinking skills.
Demonstrated ability to execute accomplishment of ACOS required registry data studies
Demonstrated ability to execute scientific studies leading to sound data to be presented to the Cancer Committee as a source of outcomes analysis.
Demonstrated ability to keep apprised of the ever-changing policies and procedures of the state of Colorado and the data reporting elements involved in this process.
Demonstrated ability to research and comply with changing federal agency regulations.
Demonstrated ability to stay up to date with regulatory and complementary agencies to adjust hospital abstracting when a specific precedent has been changed or set. The agencies include but are not limited to; coding schemes (CPT, ICD-0-3, ICD-9-CM), Surveillance Epidemiology & End Results (SEER), American Joint Commission on Cancer (AJCC).
Must have knowledge and ability to perform required aspects of the computer and its programs: follow-up letters, statistical reports, Colorado State Cancer Registry reporting and other required medical and cancer data.
Experience
At least five years of experience as a cancer data registrar in an ACOS accredited Cancer Program.

Job Title: Volunteer Privacy Consultant (NON-PAID)
Department: Operations
Staff POC: Project Manager

SUMMARY
In support of WEConnect International’ pursuit to empower women business owners across the globe, we are seeking the support of a volunteer to help provide guidance and support related to risk and regulatory compliance matters for the organization. The Data Privacy Volunteer will partner with the Data Privacy Project Manager and team members across the organization to advance the organization’s Privacy Management Program by developing or improving developed privacy policies, notices, and procedures that meet and exceed national and international regulatory requirements. This person will embody the highest ethical standards, personal and professional integrity, and respect for confidentiality. They will have demonstrated experience in developing privacy policies and notices that meet legal and regulatory requirements and standards, monitoring for legal and regulatory changes and providing quick revisions to privacy documentation and practices, communicating privacy management practices to staff members, and exemplary writing skills.

Why Volunteer
WEConnect International’s mission is to help drive money into the hands of women business owners by enabling them to compete in the global marketplace. Our vision is to help create a world in which women have the same opportunities as men to design and implement business solutions that create wealth and the sustainable prosperity of their communities. As a 501c (3) organization, we rely on volunteer support to help us achieve our goals. If you are inspired by the mission, vision, and purpose of WEConnect International, then this is a great way to help us ensure the organization is providing support and resources in a diverse environment that is committed to ensuring a transparent and consistent experience for all. Many of our volunteers work full time jobs and provide 10 to 15 hours a week of support and guidance. WEConnect International promotes a flexible environment for all and works with all volunteers to develop a schedule that is conducive for all parties. If you have been considering being part of the change in the way the world works, then this is the chance for you to take that next step.

What You Will do
Draft and/or maintain internal and externally facing data privacy documentation
Review Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs) and risk assessment and gap analysis reporting to draft or revise privacy policies and notices
Confirm and update organizational data mapping of assets and processes
Meet with department teams to update or draft business process policies, as needed
Draft and/or review and revise policies, as needed, to accurately:
Define roles and responsibilities
Address operational risks and legal requirements
Document legal basis for collecting and processing personal information
Document guiding principles for consent
Provides consequences for violating privacy policy
Ensure privacy policies and notices accurately reflect the organization’s privacy practices and are clear and transparent in how personal information is collected, used, shared, and stored
Work with department leads to ensure that privacy notices are always provided at the point of data collection and include details of:
Methods used to collect and protect personal information
Procedures on how personal information has been or is being used
Primary and secondary uses of personal information
Third parties that may process or store personal information
International transfers of personal information
Tracking or logging of activities
Description of legal rights of data subjects
Contact information for complaints and privacy regulators
Date of the last update
Monitor for changes to privacy laws and regulations and update and revise policies, as required
Communicate and, when needed, train or present new or revised privacy policies and procedures to WEConnect International staff
What Is Needed to Help Provide Support in this Opportunity
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Be able to write in a clear and concise manner
Familiarity with national and international privacy laws and regulations, specifically:
United States: California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA), Virginia Privacy Act New York Privacy Act, Colorado Privacy Act
United Kingdom: UK General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), Data Protection Act (DPA) 2018
Europe: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
Brazil: Brazilian General Data Protection Law / Lei Geral de Proteção de Dados (LGPD), amended 2019
South Africa: Protection of Personal Information Act (POPI)
Australia: Privacy Act
Japan: Act on Protection of Personal Information (APPI)
China: Personal Information Protection Law (PIPL)
Mexico: Federal law on the protection of personal data held by private parties
Singapore: Personal Data Protection Act 2012 (amended 2020)
Canada: Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA), An Act to enact the Consumer Privacy Protection Act (Bill C-11)
Turkey: Law on the Protection of Personal Data (LPPD)
Abu Dhabi Global Market Data Protection Act
Bahrain Personal Data Protection Law
Legal understanding of social media privacy protections and best practices
Experience with monitoring and clearly communicating Data Subjects Access Rights
Experience with implementing third-party vendor management practices
Experience with communicating new policies and procedures or revisions to current policies and procedures to staff and third-party vendors
Ability to translate externally facing policies into Spanish and Portuguese is preferred but not required
Must sign Non-Disclosure Agreement
EDUCATION & TRAINING
Bachelor’s degree required; minimum of six years of experience in a regulatory compliance and/or legal function is preferred.
Juris Doctor preferred from an ABA-accredited law school or equivalent in a foreign jurisdiction.
COMPUTER SKILLS
Microsoft 365: Outlook, SharePoint, and Teams; Preference for familiarity with SAP Ariba

Physical Demands and Work Environment The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those a person encounters while performing the essential functions of the role. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Organization Information: WEConnect International, a global non-profit, helps improve the lives of women across the world by supporting the growth of businesses that are owned, managed, and controlled by women. Since 2009, WEConnect International has provided education, certification, and connections to women-owned business around the world—all aimed at forging relationships with global companies and other large buyers. WEConnect International has built a network of large member buyers representing over $1 trillion in annual purchasing power and are true pioneers in a global movement to expand opportunities for women-owned businesses through procurement policies and practices. www.WEConnectInternational.org

WEConnect International is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.
